feeling spacier than an astronaut... i have been so spacey lately. no idea why. not work related. not drug related. just distracted by nothingness. does that make sense? anyway, as an example of my distracted stupidity, i went out to breakfast with a coworker and rep. i parked in a metered parking space and proceeded to NOT feed the meter. why? i don't know. i guess because everytime i park near a meter, it's after six p.m. and it is no longer necessary to pay. then i sit outside the restaurant, as the meter police give me my parking violation ticket basically right in front of me. all i would have to do is turn around and see that i was being ticketed. durrr... luckily it was only $35. hm, actually, that is more than ucla. because i've been ticketed there and it was $25. more of my hard earned cash blowing away in the winds of misfortune. another such incident? fantastic sam's. i went to get a simple trim. very simple. so simple that it took the woman twenty minutes at most to cut my hair. i just wanted a trim. but i had to wait an hour. there were three people in front of me. then when they call me next, the worker doesn't even bother to sweep away the last customer's hair. ewww. gross. i wanted to run out of there. horrid. in fact... why didn't i? always follow your instinct to run. and at the end of it all, they charge me $14. i can't believe it. what a rip off. all i did today was make phone calls and harass people. what a day.

Yes, I too received a threatening email saying that if I didn't blog, I would be killed. So here I am, blogging, so that I will no longer have to fear for my life. New Wave and Darth, this one's for you. It's an excerpt (sp?) from David Sedaris' Naked. "I have known people who can quit one job and find another in less time than it takes to quarter a fryer. Regardless of their experience, these people exude charm and confidence. The charm is something they were either born with or had beaten into them at an early age, but what gives them their confidence is the early knowledge that someone like me has also filed an application......During episodes of unemployment I find it rewarding to sleep as much as possible - anywhere from twelve to fourteen hours a day is a good starting point. Sleep spares you humiliation and saves money at the same time: nothing to eat, nothing to buy, just lie back and dream your life away. I'd wake up in the afternoon, watch my stories on TV, and then head over to the sofa for a few more hours of shut-eye. It became my habit to pick up a newspaper just after five o'clock and spend some time searching the want ads, wondering who might qualify for any of the advertised positions: vault verifier, pre-press salesman, audit technical reviewer. Show me the child who dreams of being a sausage-casing inspector....." - David Sedaris, "Something for Everyone" Hmm, the part about people having one job right after the other sure does remind me of a certain person we know................

so i was talking to my coworker who studied in japan for the past 3 months. she was telling me about this "fad" that they have over there--i forget what they're called. 15 year old girls prostituting themselves....they have this website where you like put your phone number on and men contact them...take them to karaoke bars where they get piss-drunk and "have a good time." She said that the girls never admit to having sex w/ these men but I think it's assumed. And the girls do this b/c they need extra money to buy designer stuff. Then she asked a japanese friend of hers if she knew anyone that did that and the girl said yeah. And she seemed to think it was perfectly normal. When asked why she didn't do it....the girl said that she really didn't need the money b/c she wasn't into expensive stuff. Isn't that weird?! Weird ol' Japs hehe. And she said that the really old ppl and our generation japanese are perfectly cool to foreigners but the middle aged ppl dont' like foreigners and they just want them out. I thought that was weird too--well mostly about the really old ppl cuz of the war and everything. so i thought that was an interesting tidbit i'd share w/ y'all. listening to: Beatles-Across the Universe

hello hello. i think i like this new blog format... anyway, nick -- yes, travelling is a very worthwhile experience. i plan to do it more often in the future. very near future. well, i think everyone should do the "europe thing" and of course after graduating college, it is so cliche because that is when most students go to "find themselves." but anyway i thoroughly enjoyed paris and of course the UK. oh london, can you wait? (gene lyric.) i would love to live there for a bit... and not the month i was there. more like a year+. warning to all - to not visit the alhambra target past 9 p.m. i went to browse the aisles after work and in the parking lot a man is yelling at a woman in the car. she tries to drive away and he jumps in the back and grabs the child inside... who starts screaming and crying. a passerby interferes and tries to get the man away from the child/car. then target security comes out... once inside the store, a woman is screaming on her mobile to kick some person's ass. i think all the crazies come out late at night...

New York!!! The shopping is REALLY great there, and there's tons of stuff to do. Did I mention the shopping? The food is a bit pricey, and it's best if you know someone in the city to stay with...but I loved my trip there.

I know it’s been a while…I’ve been, um, busy. Yeah, busy. So I just came back from my trip to cancun. For those of you who’ve never been there, I definitely suggest you go at least once. The place rocks!!!! Unless you don’t like clear water, powdery sand, kick-ass food, cool bars, and super super super nice people. I will never forget this trip..it was so fun! And thanks to Shirley for being a fun vacation buddy. After coming back, I realized I don’t travel enough. I hadn’t been on vacation in like 7 years prior to this trip (unless you count san diego, vegas, san fran, sac….which I don’t count as real vacations). 7 years! Anyway, there’s a point to this….my question to everyone in the house is “what interesting places have you vacationed?” (I’m asking so I have some good suggestions on where to go for my next vacation). Alright people, I’m out!

i don't think you look 364 days over 23 darth. haha. ummm not too many stories from this past trip, other than it seemed kind of rushed. it was still fun though, as i didn't lose as much as i usually anticipate i will, so score for me. these are the only two tidbits that i remember to be quite funny within the trip. #1. i almost saw darth puke, because someone gave him a full fledged punch to the groin. it seemed a tad painful. at first i was laughing, but it quickly faded, as darth did not look like he was having to much fun, can't imagine why not. but i wish that pain upon no one, especially not myself, also i do not care to ever see that happen to another man, again. #2. usher: "it's okay because darth is white." haha, that was my favorite moment. thank you. these are random tidbits/grains of knowledge about going to vegas in general: #1. although i was lucky enough to hitch a ride out there, and able to just sit in the car, i believe that flying out there is so worth it. #2. getting a decent amount of sleep is key, in vegas, and in life! #3. the mgm buffet is cute, and i like it. #4. dealers with no personality suck and make the losing money experience that much worse. #5. waiting in line for an absurd amount of time to get into something is definitely not worth it. this goes for outside of vegas as well. #6. never hit the atm. #7. drink lots of water. #8. when leaving by car, leave vegas at 8 a.m., if possible (no traffic) #9. make sure you know where the restrooms are located within the casino. #10. have fun. overall it was cool, it was one of my more laxed trips to vegas, and i know for sure that i will not be going for a while, or at least that is what i hope. it feels as though it is losing all of its glitz and glamour to me. maybe because i have been there 20+ times ever since turning 21. but it's fun when you're there.
i'll be sure to remember that darth. afterall...you really saved me when you told me all i needed to remember for all my sciences classes is "H20". can i have my 5 dollar bill now?

(and it was cool to hang out w/ sluts like you - whom i think i only met for like two seconds in college.) and now i know what the heck FTC stands for! ahahaha! the secrets of the universe are mine! and yeah, like new wave said, some other girl was wearing the same exact shirt i was (white with little red apples all over). were were only a couple people apart in line, and of course we ended up standing rightnext to each other at the show. but good thing she put on her sweater. hehe. another thing. americans do suck. or at least non-cultured ignorant people do. when in rome right?.......it's rude to disrepect the country you are in. those damn real worlders just need to appreciate the beauty and culture of paris.

yes, yes, must love the "WOOO-HOO" song so yeah, last nite i went to the BLUR show with ftc and dorkus (who was a cool person, i had never kicked it with her before), and the show was amazing. i had never seen blur before, and i didnt know what to expect. some elastica friend of mine said they suck live, but i disagree with him. they played an amazing set, some cool old songs ("to the end" - with damon fixing his suit and collar, did u like that ftc?, and "trimm trabb" was awesome!) and some wonderful new songs ("ambulance" gave me chills), have new wave or i told u that THINK TANK is awesome yet???? oh yes, and the black backup singers (i mean, "the people") were cool, brought some grooviness to the show, hehe. we were on the floor, dorkus was on the rail and ftc and i right behind her (props to her for not being tall, cheers!). and it wasnt crowded at all, which made the show much more enjoyable. so yeah, all in all, an exceptional night, i do hope they come back in the future. man, i should have taken a camera oh yes, and about americans in france: theres a reason europeans have the idea they have about americans, its not all totally myth. oh well, as long as the US is on its own continent, it will be like that. (yes, i know theres canada and mexico, but does canada have any culture?, theyre pretty much american, eh? and mexico is only good for beer and partying [in the eyes of americans]) background music: "out of time" - blur (AMAZING live!)

warning: a ramble on the real world. okay. so the new real world is set in paris. and my initial thought was, 'a bunch of self absorbed, whiny, idiotic twentysomethings got to live in paris, france for however long real world lasts and i bet they did not even appreciate it.' so i turn on the telly today and a repeat episode is on... and a guy named ace (from georgia) says flat out, 'i hate france. i hate parisians. i hate their food. i hate their small cars. i miss SUVs. i miss walmart. i miss waffles.' omigosh. he IS the american europeans think of when they think of america and americans. wow. i was blown away by his hate. and one of their roommates is french (i think) and was v. critical of how the others did not bother to learn the language. they sit at a restaurant and ace orders an american type dish but orders it all in english. not even trying to say 'fritte' or something. BUT in the end he admits that he is being ignorant and only been in paris for a week. and he walks around the city and falls in love with its beauty. and makes a commitment to keep an open mind. ahh, a happier ending. paris is seriously a beautiful city. i loved it. and i was there for less than a week. anyway, that was my ramble on that lame mtv series. hah hah.

Intro: Me First and the Gimme Gimmes - End of the Road The song I am listening to is a punk cover of the Boyz II Men "End of the Road." It's really good and really funny, so anyone that has any slight interest in the song you can go to the urlLink Fat Wreck Chords website, download it for free and check it out. Just click the link provided there. I've actually been on a Fat Wreck kick lately, and have been listening to all of the bands on the label, most of the bands are pretty good, beats listening to the pop-punk stuff out there for sure. Another band that I have been listening to is the urlLink Minibosses . I was introduced to this band through a friend, cause I don't want to take the credit for it just in case you don't like it, hehe. They are a Nintendo cover band, they play theme songs from the original Nintendo games, such as, Contra, Rygar, Mike Tyson's Punch Out, Castlevania, Wizards and Warriors, Ghosts N' Goblins, etc. Again free downloads are available at the site, actually all of their songs are available there. I know they are a novelty act, but it's fun to listen to the way they arranged and rock out to the tune of those songs. Worth checking out if you were a Nintendo fan, back in the days, i was a kid, i'm not a kid anymore, but some days I wish I was a kid again. Those lyrics ring so true to my ears. Actually I wouldn't really care to be a kid again, but it was fun back then, cause I didn't have to deal with any issues really. Well at this point I really can't complain on my behalf, there's no trouble a brewin' so i'm pleased with that and for sure I will not be making myself any unnecessary drama. Vegas in 8 Days, I am scared, no repeat performance will be staged by me like the last time I went, Darth this time you can take over the duties, since it's your birthday and all. I think we should go hit up Lloyd for some free bowling though, what do you think? I'll bring the parking lady as insurance. Haha. Outro: Rufio - Decency

okay, about the whole spending money on frivolous items topic. i think it's okay, but as long as it's not too out of hand. i make big purchases on items i know i don't need, but if it makes me feel good at the time, i get it. Retail therapy works wonders. but i think about it before i buy it: do i really need this? how about saving your money up for a big trip? or for tickets to a band you're dying to see?..i don't know.. on another note: i'm sorta bummed about the fifth HP book release. I'll be out of town when it comes out, and I won't be able to pick it up until July 1st! Boo! perhaps it is a blessing in disguise. maybe i'll be able to reread HP 3 and 4 before then so i can reacquaint myself. wishful thinking never hurt anybody, or did it?

hiya. just got back from my first ever dodger game. it was alright. i don't think i'll spend another twenty to go again though. i was half paying attention/half reading but baseball IS slow so why not multi-task... the dodger dog was okay. not too yummy. i have a bit of a tummy ache actually. hm, i think the highlight was the random fight in the parking lot. that was entertaining. hah hah. as for the spending money on frivolous items discussion... i do it all the time. not a good thing but i don't think it's completely a bad thing either. because it gives me some enjoyment albeit temporarily. and sometimes money doesn't do any good just sitting around collecting dust. i went to a wherehouse sale today. it was so l.a. new wave, you missed out. not only were trucker hats majorly discounted, you could overhear conversations of people talking about their PR person, agent, or latest audition. go l.a.!

Hedwig that is the best analogy I have ever heard. Haha. Kudos to you. Darth I agree that thinking too much about one subject for long periods of time is a downer. You sometimes just become all wrapped up in a single thought and it just bugs you for some time until it is out of your system. To answer your question though, yes I have had situations like you have mentioned and simply put it sucks. It sucks because you are not supposed to know. It sucks because you are not supposed to say anything. Honestly though, if you overheard it, it's a done deal. If it wasn't meant to be overheard somehow, then the persons responsible for keeping it hush, hush, are the ones that should deal with the consequences, not you. So why not just relieve yourself of the anguish and do whatever is necessary to help you find your happy place. Like Happy Gilmore, when he would see his grandma, Tubbs, and the midget. I have a question myself to ask. Do you think it's okay to every once in a while just spend your money on frivolous things, you know like things you really don't need, but you want, just so you can have it? I guess a good example of frivolous would be like, my abundant collection of random toys and other collectibles. Just curious as to see what you all think. I'm just asking because i'm looking to purchase some items, that are quite pricey, but unnecessary, and it wouldn't really hurt me if I did not have them.

Yes, I think girls basically want a nice guy who can be aggressive and will stand up for himself. (This has nothing to do with my benefit. I don't need a guy to defend my honor. I was just using that example for sake of argument.) I don't want an asshole cocky obnoxious boyfriend who has complete disregard for other's opinions and feelings. Does that make sense? I'm more or less referring to one of the lame guys that New Wave mentioned in her blog. It's good to be opinionated and have a mind of your own, but I still think you should respect other's opinions at the same time. You shouldn't try and make people feel all stupid if they watch 24. OR you shouldn't make people feel like they have bad taste in music for liking Beulah (* ahem New Wave). Not like I rag on the Cure all the time or anything!

i get what dorkus is saying...you want someone who is genuinely nice...deep down a good guy....but when the time calls, you want him to have the ability to be aggressive. you don't want some completely passive guy. i had it articulately put in my mind when i started this blog but my mind got sidetracked by...well nothing. i had a brainfart. :P it's kind of like for guys....you don't want to marry a whore...you want to marry a nice respectable girl who is a good wife, etc etc.....but behind closed doors you want your wife to be a whore. haha. you get it now?? :D I'M HOME! listening to: john mayer-covered in the rain(live)

dorkus i'm a little confused, your statement in a way seems to contradict itself, i guess I can understand what you are saying but at the same time, your second paragraph seems to retract from what you had said in the first. So you don't want so you don't want a cocky, obnoxious person unless it can benefit you in some way? so what would make that different from if they were like that all the time? Do you just not want them to act that way to you, but then still be able to show off how manly they are too everyone else out there? just curious....moving on....have you ever had something on your mind that bugs you a lot, but at the same time you probably aren't supposed to know, like you overheard something? Bravo! I am glad someone has called attention to this mind boggling phenomenon. Why are girls interested in such assholes? I honestly don't get it. Maybe it comes from low self-esteem. I would never for a minute even consider someone who is so self righteous, so cocky, and so obnoxious like that. New Wave, you're right. We ARE better than that. We don't need super jerk boyfriends who belittle our thoughts and opinions. However, I will say this, I think that most girls (including me) are interested in guys with Asshole Potential. That is, girls are interested in guys who could have the potential to be an asshole when needed (let's just say he's defending your honor or something); who wants to date a Too Nice Guy with No Balls? I don't. Nice guys are great, but there is a thing as being too nice.

this past weekend was sweet. first off, I didn't have to drive up to L.A. cause darth came down. we drank quite a bit down at the gaslamp and since i was buzzed, just a tad, when we left to go watch the matrix, we started walking off in the wrong direction. haha. fortunately, darth figured it out. so we bumped into hare krishnas instead. the following day we went to go eat at Seau's, where we tried Mama Seau's Special Teriyaki Sauce, you would think Mama Seau would be his mom's teriyaki sauce, but nope, it's one of Brad's friends aunt's special blend that he uses. you can't fool me Junior Seau! after this went to the Padres game, where some old asian parking lady laughed at me. as i was approaching her to purchase a parking permit, i asked if the game was sold out, and she smirked and laughed at me. it's an honest question! right? haha. then we actually reached the stadium and game. we bought the cheap seats, but were upgraded by the Pad Squad about 25 rows from first base, i guess that was kind of cool since the game was high scoring and entertaining, also helped that these two people we were sitting next to, julie and her platonic guy friend, were making fun of each other the entire time and arguing about random things, but they were cool. darth and i even taught her to eat sunflower seeds, which was interesting all in itself. back to the Pad Squad, it is pronounced Pahd Squad, not the way it is spelled, just to let you people know, k? so good times were had. and i think i gained about 10 pounds too. oh and darth last i heard ty, the other one, are hanging out with the asian parking lady.

Hello, hi, hot mike, hot mike......okay. Hi everyone I would like to report the comeback of Mr. Sly Stallone. As you all know he is currently in the blockbuster hit film Spy Kids 3-D, and it grossed the most money this past weekend. To top off this great feat, he is currently working on a couple projects. The first one as well all know is the 6th installment of the Rocky series, I forget the exact title of it, but I bet the plot has to deal with him being down on his luck, and coming out of the cellar and triumphing overall, all alongside with an awesome musical score. I for one cannot wait til this flick comes out. Now on to his other project. I don't know how many of you have read the book LAbyrinth, I know Darth has, but Sly's next project is about the Rampart Scandal's regarding the deaths of Tupac and Biggie, and the role that Suge and Death Row played in it. Sly is directing it, and is playing the part of Detective Russell Poole. I do not know when it will be released, or when it is slated to start production, but I for sure want to watch it when it comes out. I think the title is Thugz "something or rather." That is my Sly report. Thank you and good day.

oh new wave. funny about the craig's list posting. this guy is creepy. but my friend and i would like to mess with him like in 'ghost world.' hee hee. anyway, so new wave was watching 'lizzie mcguire' (sorry, new wave but people should know so you can get the proper help) and the disney channel was spouting this message about "working hard because then your dreams can come true." and i was thinking about this because i had just read an article about hollywood. there are 45,000 or so screenplays registered to the screen writers guild yet 500 films are made a year. and that's just how many are made. just think how many are profitable! so we tell our kids to follow their dreams and they will come true but there are many who want to make it big as an actor or a screenwriter and never will. not that i'm saying we should tell kids, look you probably won't make it in this industry unless you have real talent. but i guess my end conclusion is that you should not watch 'lizzie mcguire' because it's all bollocks.

Currently watching: the talented mr. Ripley….this movie rocks Hey party people I have been out of the loop for a while, but back from Hawaii now...and here is my trip report, it will be long so brace yourself: Got to the hotel we were booked for, and the hotel had overbooked itself by like 300 people!!! great start I know, anyway they were able to make arrangements for us at another hotel down the street, which we found wasn't as nice (two of the girls on the trip are lawyers and already in the process of writing letters and such in hopes of getting a refund or free rooms in the future) anyway after that fiasco met up with all our sister church members from Japan. Even though we didn't speak much Japanese and they spoke very little English we still found ways to communicate and had a great time just hanging out with them. I was put in a room with a 15year old Japanese kid, which at first i was very disappointed with as it was not who I thought I’d be staying with. As it turned out we were able to get along great and had a lot of the same interests, for example sleeping through any alarm clock even the one that was supposed to wake us up for morning devotions...haha.... Second day we headed out to the Polynesian center for a day of culture of the islands and a luau. Saturday was a free day, first I went to the huge swap meet to get knick knacks and random gifts for people.....hung out with this one kid who goes to my church and I’ve known for years but never spoke too, but found that he is really sarcastically funny. That night we had our big dinner and gift exchanges with the two churches. It was a great time. I think the best time was when the youths from the two churches got together to hang out. A big group of us played drinking games together on Monday night. I taught them pyramid (thanks t.w.i.f.o.s.l.y. !!!!!) and then we played the hand signs game where you have to watch ones hands signals and if they call yours you have to do someone else’s and if you mess up you have to drink…its highly entertaining with big groups. Other random things I did: Went to Pearl Harbor…yes I know its very touristy but its one of those things that I had to do and was very emotional for me. My grandmother had told my family not to come home without going there and thus it was number one on our priority list of things to do. Went to the beach four times, so I kinda have a tan, but being white its not a real tan. Rented the mighty geo tracker and toured the island on our own. Played a round of golf with my friend, at first i wasn't looking forward to it, cause it was a little pricey but i gotta say it was one of the best things i did, it was so nice out, i got to use expensive clubs and shot one of my better games!! golf is fun again everyone should go (nick edney looking your way) Every night most young adults would get together for laughs and fun times staring at the female entrepreneurs and trying to guess which one would get a date first….it was highly entertaining. I even got a line from one of them when I was walking back to the hotel. One of the kids wanted to get their picture taken with one of them, so I took him out and when he asked one of the girls she responded with this ain’t Disneyland kid… haha…I nearly fell over laughing… Sorry this is still long, if you have any other questions to ask me feel free or I can just tell you next time I see you. In closing Hawaii was super duper fun, great weather, great food, great people, I would love to go again. I also want to go to Japan because everyone from Japan kept telling me that my turn to go is next (every other year our church sends someone to japan to visit their church) Oh yeah and I even got to see my boyhood hero Hulk Hogan, that makes the trip pretty much perfect….haha

CALLING ALL GUYS ... START PLAYING WITH YOUR DING A LING :) Masturbating Lowers Prostate Cancer Risk -Study LONDON (Reuters) - Frequent masturbation, particularly in the 20s, helps prevent prostate cancer (news - web sites) later in life, according to new research. Australian scientists have shown that the more men masturbate between the ages of 20 and 50, the less likely they are to develop the disease that kills more than half a million men each year. They suspect that frequent ejaculation has a protective effect against the cancer because it prevents dangerous carcinogens from building up in the gland. "The more you flush the ducts out, the less there is to hang around and damage the cells that line them," Graham Giles, of the Cancer Council Victoria in Melbourne, told New Scientist magazine on Wednesday. In a survey of 1,079 prostate cancer patients and 1,259 healthy men, Giles and his team discovered that men who ejaculated more than five times a week in their 20s were a third less likely to develop an aggressive form of the disease. The findings contradict previous studies which suggested that having a variety of partners or frequent sexual activity could increase the risk of prostate cancer by 40 percent. But Giles said the earlier research concentrated on intercourse, whereas his study focused on masturbation. Infections caused by sexual activity could account for the different findings. "Men have many ways of using their prostate which don't involve women or other men," he added.

Actors: 1. brendan fraser - for the sheer fact that he is extremely good looking ... well to me .... and he is just an all around great guy. best movie he has been in is gods and monsters. 2. john cusack - good looking and i love the movies he is in ... well most of them but my fav. has to be better off dead. ha ha ... if you have not seen this movie go and get it. 3. kevin spacey - totally and absolutely respect this man. he is hands down a wonderful actor and he does great movies. 4. jet li - not a great actor but a great fighter and i have to admit i pretty much watch anything he is in :) 5. johnny depp - he is good looking and strange and good looking and does cool movies and rounding out the bottom are morgan freeman, steve buscemi and tony leung. Actress: 1. susan sarandon - completely respect her and love what she does. she is one of those older but still sexy in her own way types. 2. jodie foster - love her work and she is just so respectable ... a real fighter. i really liked her in silence of the lambs and contact and little man tate. 3. winona ryder - though her movies of late have been bad (shiver) ex. lost souls, autumn in new york and mr. deeds ... very very bad i love her 80's and early 90's stuff. love heathers and edward scissorhands 4. sandra bullock - good looking and super charming ... i will pretty much see anything she is in 5. drew barrymore - she is just so fun and cool and yea she is good .. me sleep now.

Intro: The Samples - Feel Us Shaking Hello everyone. The sweetest thing happened today. After work I went out surfing by myself, and I was waiting for my wave, I saw a fin come up out of the ocean. First thought was, oh crap, a shark. First reaction, poop my pants. Second thought, wait sharks don't have curved fins and come up for air. Second reaction, not stink up my pants, and realize the awesome sight i'm seeing. Yes as I was out there, I saw a dolphin a mere 10 feet away from me. It was one of those sights that's just pure. I saw it come up for air and dive back under a few times until it was out of my view. That's the closest I have ever been to one not counting Sea World and the likes, so I must say that it was good stuff. Another guy told me there were 3 of them, but I only saw 1. After this I caught my first wave ever on my board. I have been going out for the past week and a half now, and I must say, the feeling was incredible, I felt such adrenaline rushing through me. Just plain rad. I failed horribly after that, but I do know that i'm making progress, and that's all that really counts for me. Shortboards are so much harder than longboards, but after getting on my shorty, I feel that I reached a milestone, because it was one of those things I told myself i'd do before I died, and i've done it! I'm not quitting now, but it's just a great feeling. Sorry if this seems very focused on me, but i'm excited as crap right now. Thank you have a good day! Outro: Pearl Jam - Yellow Ledbetter
who's bored? my fam reunion pics are up at urlLink www.novette.com

I had a really good long 4th of July break also. I had Thursday off, so on Wednesday after watching Legally Blonde 2 with my co-worker I drove up to SF with Billy. We left around 11:30 and got there at 5 in the morning. I feel bad because I slept practically the whole way there. =) We stayed with my sis who has an apartment in there until August...it's a little less then a mile from Fisherman's Wharf. On Thursday we went shopping at Union Square and I was in heaven! I'm not much of a shopper, not like most girls but I LOVE BARGAINS. They had really good sales at Macy's and Banana Republic so I had a field day. =) Anyways, that night we had dinner with one of my good friends and we met her new boyfriend and went to a karaoke place. On Friday we went to Palace of Fine Arts, Golden Gate Park, swimming and to Fisherman's Wharf for some clam chowder and fireworks. It was a busy day but lots of fun. I decided that the Palace of Fine Arts is my favorite place in San Francisco. On Saturday we did some more shopping and headed back home. It was a great trip...San Francisco seems like a cross between N.Y. and L.A. It's not as busy and crowded as N.Y. but they still have the "culture" that L.A.'s missing. Does that make any sense?
urlLink stephen king reviews HP 5 OotP:

ok ok so I finally decided to blog about my 4th. been too lazy to blog anything really. anyhow, we had our family reunion this last week...it's my grandfather's side of the family..the Lims. On Tuesday, my cousin Grace from Michigan came to hang out. We went shopping, watched Legally Blonde and went to TGIF's w/ my other cousin and her friends. Good times. Then on Thurs my aunt/uncle/cousins from Canada came back from Vegas and I took the boys(13/14) to see T3 and it was a v. entertaining movie. Like most action movies I went in not expecting much and i enjoyed it alot. Friday was the Lim Family Reunion Picnic in San Diego(Bonita/Chula Vista area). It started off crappy cuz we had to go pick up the food and that shit spilled ALL OVER my trunk which caused it to reek of...I think it was the shrimp paste...for the next week(I just cleaned it up yesterday and there is still a hint of that smell elch!!!). Oh and we missed all the introductions so i totally didn't know anyone or where they came from and THAT sucked. But the food was really good and i met my cousins from virginia, texas, michigan, maryland...and I forget where else...oh yeah L.A. Supposedly one of my cousins spins for Black Eyed Peas....I'm not a big fan so I'll just give that a *shrug*. Then my cousins and I went to Novette's house and swam, chilled, relaxed.. I swear it felt like I was on a resort cuz we were just lazing about. There, I learned how to surf...in a pool...but it was still fun! I learned the basics: how to balance on teh surfboard to paddle, stratling the surfboard and pushing up on it to stand/kneel. That night we went out w/ the "younger generation" meaning teens and up. The 21 and under kids went to coffee shops/wandered around at the gaslamp quarter while the 21+ crowd went into this bar/club called The Bitter End. It was really fun. I danced my ass off....where are my quarters new wave?? Saturday was the family party at Novette's house. OMG!!! my uncle made the most tender bestest pork roast dealie. SO FREAKIN GOOD. I ate that for breakfast and lunch haha. Kyle came down and we all went swimming for like 3 hours. I also learned how to play this north-midwestern card game called Yuker(pronounced you-ker). It takes about 45 min to learn---seriously haha. Then I went back with Kyle and we went to his friends bday thing at D&B in Ontario. His friend came across tickets coming out of that game where you try to knock the coins over the edge...and the tickets kept coming....and coming....and coming. And they were free! So all in all Kyle, his friend Justin and I all split 1400 tickets. I got a D&B glass and a YO YO!!!!! the yo yo is awesome hehe. Sunday was my cousin Franco's bday party in Irvine. So that was my weekend or week. Pretty busy, which explains how tired I am. But wait it's not over! what is this madness ... why is T.W.I.F.O.S.L.Y blogging so much. what is going on .... i'm in shock. for reals. eh oh well. loved your rave story ftc ... just loved it. ha ha. especially the light show part ... i think E man can totally relate huh. ha ha. as for work ... welcome to the horrors of my world. add to that list of complaints an hour communte and evil office policies and yea that's my life. nevertheless that pay check does feel pretty good cause you get to buy crap with it :) well how was everyone's fourth. for me it was actually pretty good ... on thurs i went drinking with pigern, darth, mac and his gf and my friend eric at lucky baldwin's. i fricking love this one beer there ... don't know why. just some really good stuff. on friday went to see the pernice brothers at spaceland. i spent most of the time wondering why the audience was mainly white older male ... strange strange. but the pernice brothers were great ... they played a lot of stuff from the world will come to end album and i say at least 7 or 8 songs from their new cd yours, mine and ours. i won't lie ... i am not a big fan of the spaceland venue. it was so ... um not my thing. sat. i did nothing and i loved it. i mean just sitting around on my lazy ass. it was great. sunday i went and saw mos def. that was a good show ... real hip hop you know. the second opening act ... darn i forgot his name but he had xzibit come out and rap with him. nice nice. and then mos came out ... looking all little boy cute and did his deal then talib kweli came out with him and they did some blackstar stuff. i was just happy cause he did ms. fat booty and i LOVE THAT SONG. ha ha. actually i liked most of the stuff they did. good stuff. the audience was alright ... a bit too many wiggers for me but still nice. been working really hard on this simpsons puzzle. it is hard like a mother. it is one of those mosiac types ... lots of little pictures become a bigger one. (sigh) it is killing me. to be honest i think that is all i worked on this weekend. blasting on the stero: the cure - galore album ... i actually really don't like this album but i must admit they did put all their popular songs on this thing.
"This flooble chatterbox is temporarily unavailable. It will be back up shortly." NO! i want chatterbox now! dammit! :p

"things dont have to be this way, catch me on a better day" ("fix me now" by garbage is on) ok so last nite, i went to my first rave ever, and most likely the last one. it was a very underground rave, well i'm assuming it was, cos there were like 100 people there. we thought it was going to be in glendale, which seemed kinda weird, but it turned out that the glandale site was just a place to get tickets and directions to the actual rave which was in LANCASTER!!!! argh!!! so i drove out there. they played music called "happy hardcore" which is really fast, and i just couldn't get into, guess it was due to my drug-free self. i should have thrown some alcohol in my trunk *sigh* anyway, i ended up spending 10 bucks to take naps in my car in the middle of nowhere. oh yeah, and i got to see some e-tards sit on the dirt getting a light show, fun stuff (rolls eyes) to make matters worse, i arrived home at approximately 6:30 a.m., woke up at 9 a.m. and worked from 11 until 8 pm. jobs suck MAJOR ASS!! i used to do nothing, but at least i knew i did nothing but stay home and waste the day away. now, i go to work, get all tired and sleepy, come home, sleep, and know i did nothing all day. at least before i was just chillaxing all day long, and it was all good. i guess i will feel differently when i get paid and actually have something to show for my pain. hehe, as if my job is hard. but hey, sundays at best buy are BUSY!!! we supposedly closed at 6 pm, but people were still coming in at 6:20 and i rang someone up at 6:45. NOTE TO EVERYONE: please! dont go to a store after they are closed and try to do some shopping!!!! its sooo annoying. ok, well thats all for now later lates ending with "hanging around" by the cardigans oh yeah, dorkus, i wanted to ask u what 80s club that is. thanks :D

HAPPY FOURTH OF JULY
Hope everyone has a great 4th of July Weekend!

hello everyone. i'm back! not like anybody noticed i was gone. i spent 11 days in boston and new york, and although i did enjoy myself (sorry to disappoint pigern), it felt like a really long time to be gone. i won't bore you with the details of my trip. i just want to say that i did not hear one person say, "i'm waiting on line." then again, i was busy blending in with the new yorkers and not paying attention to anyone else. in short, my attitude problem got bigger, and i have a newfound dislike for tourists. oh yes, one more thing. if you are ever on the east coast, check out the musical Urinetown. If you haven't heard of it, it's about a town in a futuristic setting where you have to pay to use the restroom. Sounds dumb, the title sounds weird, but trust me, it's very very funny. Very witty, tongue in cheek, Simpsons-esque even. plus Tom Cavanagh (the bowling alley lawyer from "Ed") played the lead character. I'm so in love with him. (New York in June is absolutely disgusting. Smog, smoke, dirt, humidity, body odors, you name it.)

it's almost one but i had to type my review of "american splendor." it is brilliant. v. witty and funny but not the dumb type of humor (i.e. adam sandler). and the film is not shot in a conventional way. but it goes behind the camera, incorporates comic strip illustrations. i am so happy to have fin-nally seen a movie worth watching. i thought "swimming pool" would do it for me... but no. not really. i would watch "american splendor" again. especially since the guy next to me was one of those people who would say, "omigosh, i can't believe he did that!" or repeat the line just said while chuckling. okay. this is not your living room. hello? so annoying. anyway, this is a film i recommend!

wow. it's great to be back on American soil. to be in a real English speaking country again. just got back late last night from my trip to Paris, France. it was a great trip: France is a beautiful country with so much culture to be had. not everyone is rude; we did some encounter some rudness, but we also met some perfectly nice people too. a lot of the time was spent with family we have not seen in years, and some of my parent's childhood friends. so during my two weeks there, we visited all the monuments and touristy spots (aren't we obligated or something?): Tour Eiffel, Sacre Couer, Place de la Concorde, Arc de Triumphe, Notre Dame, Louvre (where we saw the real Mona Lisa), Montmartre (Amelie-town), Chateau des Versailles, Champs Elysees, Mont St Michel. we drove through Normandy to get to Mont St Michel, and I fell in love with Normandy - it's what I picture when I think of France: the green fields and flowers, charming cottages with the yard gnomes, the local shops and bakeries. it's gorgeous. when I go back to France, I would like to either visit Normandy, or Monaco and Corsica. we also spent a day in London, England, and another day in Brugge, Belgium. i loved Belgium! and London too! I'm thinking I want to spend more time in England next year (ahem, looking your way - New Wave and Pigern). the bad thing about the trip was that it was a million degrees outside. the whole time i was there it was 95 - 105 degrees outside, humid, and NO air conditioning anywhere!! NO AIR CONDITIONING PEOPLE!!! NONE! So you are perpetually sweating, from the minute you get to France and minute you leave. You take a shower at night, and you have to hose off in the morning again. You sleep with all your windows and doors open, and you wake up several times a night because it is that hot. It's like you're living in a furnace. AND to top it off, you have to get on the bus and subway everyday to stand next to Frenchie who decides that they are too good for deodorant, so you must block off your sense of smell or you will die. you never feel shower fresh, it's quite disgusting. so there were some days where we were all just cranky because we couldn't take the heat. folks, i'm not kidding or anything, the heat wave was deadly: unfortunately, the French government estimated that 3000 people have died. oh yeah, I wish I could at least speak a little French - it would have made things easier, but the most i know is the standard greetings and how to count. i can figure out some things because of the years i took spanish, but really, the language barrier makes things difficult sometimes. so that's why i was kind of glad to go to england and belgium where they speak English! wow, i feel so...American. sad. so overall, a great trip was had, but i'm glad to be home. i have several reminders of france: besides my souvenirs, i have the nastiest mosquito (?) bite you will ever see. something bit me - I'm not sure what it was - a mosquito, a wasp, a small animal - on my leg. it looks like a bug bite, but then it looks bruised and bloody (underneath the skin), so although i'm not actually bleeding or oozing anything, it looks gross! even i get disgusted everytime i look at it. that's just me though - i get allergic reactions to bug bites - anybody else would get a small bump from a mosquito, i get raised mounds with the diamater of a golf ball. hehe. i hope i thoroughly grossed everyone out, as i so enjoyed doing to my family members. hehe. au revoir! p.s. bonus purchase: a limited edition of the Amelie soundtrack (the French version), with four additional songs from Yann Tiersen.

currently listening to: millencolin - black eye so i'm sitting here at the office right now, being bored. i have work to do, but don't feel like doing it right now, so i'll let it pile up some, then be pissed later that i have work to do. anyways i have random thoughts going on through my head, and thought i'd spill some of it out. yesterday i met up with one an old church buddy that i have known since we were in the 3rd grade. he came to san diego from atlanta for a conference. i haven't seen him since a couple years back, but we caught up for some dinner and spirits. the point is, that ever since i've known him, he's evolved/changed. we are the same age, but he looks like he's about 4 years older than i, and has gotten his priorities straight. he dresses in slacks, nice shoes, izod's, the whole nine. then i look at other people i know, and everyone is still stuck in the same motif as however long i've known them, sure they've gotten jobs, have grown older, etc. thing is they still look the same and act the same, in my opinion. i'm not saying this is everyone, but a vast majority seems that way, and i'm sure i haven't changed either. i don't know why this is, maybe it is because i see them more often, but still, i would expect at least some changes. to me it is weird. my goal right now is to just finish up my little tenure here in san diego, and get back into grad school. after that there is a question mark, all i know is that i want to be running my own things, and not working for someone. whatever happened to the "what do you want to be when you grow up?" i sure as hell didn't want to be an accountant. weak. i feel like i'm in office space. and michael bolton is a no talent ass clown. out with: no use for a name - redemption song

no one blogs anymore ... BOOOOOOOOOOOOO !!!!!!!!! i hate having to be a closet radiohead fan. i have been listening to ok computer all day today ... over and over and over again and i'm just amazed at how stellar the album is. fucking amazing :) i mean ok computer came out in 1997, over 6 years ago, and it is still able to leave such a good impression. i remember when i use to dl all their b-sides and make cds of them and all this stuff. i really liked radiohead before they got all monster big and god like. sheesh. and you know what is funny is how much radiohead wants people to love them ... they want to be accepted and loved and admired. i think thom feeds off of it but i'm still bitter towards the band for all that W.A.S.T.E mishap but it's all good. (sigh) i really do love their music ... and i guess now so does half the general public. blasting on the stereo: climbing up the walls - radiohead ... this song is so amazing

i'm all moved in! it only took two days so i'm glad that it worked out ok. kyle's family helped me move my stuff in, along w/ darren. then at night my mom and sis came over and helped me clean. today novette came to visit me...my first visitor! and she brought some thai food...yum. it was really good timing cuz matess and i were getting hungry. it's fun setting up a new place. your old things find new places and everything is like new. :) i feel like i have stuff to do...but i havne't organized my head to think about it yet. perhaps i should make a list of things to do. i know i want to change my sprint plan and phone number...and i have to cancel the gas and electric in philly....but amy never emailed me back. then i just gotta get ready for school in general. orientation is in two days...craziness. then it's school like i've never had before. 8-4 everyday....WOOHOO! i'm SO looking fwd to it. bleh. hopefully it will be fun...but when is studying ever fun. *shrug* alrighty i'm gonna continue to take my lil weave thingie i got from seaworld out of my hair...it's annoying. soundtrack: girl from ipanima--astrid gilberto

A friend sent me this poem. I thought it was funny. Hee hee. This Be The Verse By Philip Larkin They fuck you up, your mum and dad. They may not mean to, but they do. They fill you with the faults they had And add some extra, just for you. But they were fucked up in their turn By fools in old-style hats and coats, Who half the time were soppy-stern And half at one another's throats. Man hands on misery to man. It deepens like a coastal shelf. Get out as early as you can, And don't have any kids yourself.

AMAZING ... that's how i would describe tonight's radiohead show. i know i sounded displeased in my last blog but scratch it. the setlist from yesterday was just alright but tonight's was mind blowing. it was sooooo good. they played some of the songs i wanted to hear like morning bell, no surprises and i might be wrong :) i think the real treat for a lot of people was (drumroll ...) they played creep. that was pretty fricking amazing ... WOW is all i have to say. dang. it was quite impressive. what would have topped it is if they played true love waits. that song is wonderful. the audience this time was really good ... they got into the songs and seemed really happy. only prob. was some girl walked down i guess from her far seats and basically crammed her way into my seats >:ol .... grrrrrrrr. that made me mad. oh and leaving the parking lot some lame girl in a jetta was too scared to move her car in fear she might hit another, cause we had stacked parking, so we were boxed in for a bit .... grrrrr. yea so now i'm in love with radiohead again. so goes my on again/off again love affair with them. ugh. they are just so good. on a side note, in case you were wondering about my devotion to the cure, i raced home after the show so i could tape the cure on craig kilborn. they taped it last thurs but aired it today. so lame, i really don't like craig kilborn. oh well. spinning: kid a - radiohead

pigern, SAVE YOURSELF. do not read friendster profiles or you will be pissed off by the number of dumb people out there. seriously. i've read a couple profiles, but then i stopped to ask myself why. do i care about these people? NO. do i have any intentions of sending a friendster message? hell NO. (oh yeah, a friendster pet peeve of mine is when people list various magazines as their favorite books. my message to people who do this: a magazine is not a book. if you do not have a favorite book or if you do not read, please leave the question blank.) blahhh. just venting, i guess. i guess the internet connects you in an impersonal way. sorta. make sense?...email is cool and all, but remember the days when we would write actual letters? listening to: The Rocking Hose Winner - steps in sand

random thoughts ... went to see radiohead yesterday at the bowl. although i am trying to distance myself from them due to numerous reasons, i must admit they do put on quite a bad ass show (darn them all) ... and i want to put dancing thom in my pocket and just carry him around all the time. :) but to my point .... i was super annoyed at the show cause it was so L.A. ugh. i hate fucking L.A-ers. they just stand there caring about their self image and talking about who they know, what fab. job or life they are leading and who they had drinks with the other night or what stupid ass screenplay/production/director/(insert a ton of other stuff) they are working on. grrrr. so i was looking at the lyrics to paranoid android and one line goes "the yuppies networking, the vomit the vomit" and found myself laughing so hard. here are individuals who attend radiohead concerts and they are the types that radiohead sings out against but then again radiohead robbed their true fans by making us see their precious asses at the butt huge hollywood motherfu**ing bowl so go figure. end conclusion ... hate LA a lot a lot and secretly ... very very secretly love radiohead .... ha ha. spinning: paranoid android - radiohead p.s. see not only do i despise "the OC" .... i loathe LA. hey that would be a great shirt, instead of i love LA it should read i loathe LA. ha ha funny stuff.
wow. for favorite books, this girl listed a bunch of magazines (cosmo, maxim, etc.). hm... i think i should stop browsing people's profiles. must... stop... now...

do you ever think the internet makes you feel more isolated? everyone always raves it makes you more connected blah blah. but sometimes i think it makes you feel more alone. so this is another random observation about friendster: i think that people who are not classically attractive have an advantage in the sense that they have more time to develop their interests and tastes. you know, go to theatre, read books, and develop a sense of what is really worthwhile or intellectual. i came to this thought after randomly browsing through people's profiles and there is a high correlation between those who are attractive (at least in the photos they post) and dreadfully poor tastes and/or blank profiles. Example: a girl who likes both dashboard confessional, all-american rejects PLUS sweet home alabama. i could excuse some for "so bad it's good" but only some (i.e. new wave fancying cheesy 80s films). or their "about me" blurbs are so generic and dull. perhaps i am being snobbish.

But I like plastic. I want to be plastic.

I'll start with the Inland Invasion...thank goodness we were in the shade, cause i would have died, being white isn't that great when you are in the sun, you kinda burn....fast...anyway......i enjoyed the time there most bands were somewhat entertaining.....violent femmes were fun and goofy....fountains of wayen were weak......interpool were okay, the guy has a cool voice i'll give him that much....now to the 3 closing.......hot hot heat i have to say i was a bit surprised by, not so much of their music but of their lead singer, its american idol's justin guarini...serious its him, he has the same goofy hair and smiles like him....haha....duran duran was cool, they seemed pissed at the sound system though, i would have liked to see them play a bit longer but its all good, they were a real flashback....then some band called the cure came on, i guess they are big or something cause people seemed to go crazy over them...they were quite good and played for 3 hours...someone was quite ecstatic (looking at new wave) anyway good times were had.......... now onto the real news....DENVER JUST KICKED THE CRAP OUT OF THE TRAIDERS 31-10....and honestly it wasn't even that close....haha..yeah that makes me feel pretty good....work won't be as crappy as usual tomorrow i guess..haha and here is your second big news update...STAR WARS EPISODE 3 has finished shooting...now we just have to wait a year and a half for all the special effects to be added in and we will be good to go...better start lining up soon!!!! okay i guess thats enough for me now....vegas...again in 4 days...alcoholic fest II

currently listening to: REO Speedwagon - I Can't Fight This Feeling Anymore hahahahaha. man i'm so lame, why am i listening to REO Speedwagon. i do wish i had a cool shirt like Billy Madison though to wear with a cool denim jacket. so last week i was contacted by 4 different people through friendster that i had lost touch with. it's been like 5-7 years since i last saw any of them. we were really good friends back then too, but we never went to the same school, or lived in a close proximity, so it just fizzled i guess. so thanks to friendster i am talking to all of them again, which is very cool. weird how things work out isn't it? and so life goes on. darth please don't comment about the show life goes on, it was not a cool, but it makes me smile. hahaha. oh yeah i saw lost in translation yesterday. bill murray is sweet, his humor is pure genius. currently listening to: Saves The Day - Sell My Old Clothes, I'm Off to Heaven

i wanted to blog yesterday but i was WAY TOO TIRED. so the cure concert was..... well darth and i left around 1 to head out to lovely devore, ca and we didn't actually park and get out of the car till around 3:30. that's right people it took over 2 hours to get there and most of the traffic was getting into the place and parking the car. once that was said and done it was a good 20 min or more hike to the venue (cause we parked ass far in some dirt lot) in the freaking hot sun. it was so hot .... blech. once inside we were faced with a huge crowd of people buying food and merch. so we made our way to our seats which were 10th row but seriously so far off to the side :( that we got an angle view most of the time but we were close. the pit rail/fence was less than 20 ft from us. when we got there we had already missed dashboard confessional ... sorry mac ... so we just got to see from fountain of wayne and on. yea i was so not impressed by fow at all ... after that was marc a. from soft cell who was alright, of course the fans went wild for tainted love, then interpol came on and played a pretty basic set, i don't understand why they are so liked. then the psychedelic furs came on ... who i am currently really really into now. though richard, the leader singer, tripped and fell over some stage equipment i think they sounded great and seemed like such nice chaps. :) after them was the violent femmes and they were pretty cool but i'm not really into their music, then echo & the bunnymen who were really good as well. then it was hot hot heat, now put in mind i saw them at the troub. with dorkus on my b-day earlier this year and now they are the third act on the main stage for kroq's inland invasion. yea you can tell i don't think they are worth that position but i guess kroq thought they were. they played an okay set ...eh pretty forgettable. the only part i really loved was someone was screaming "you are not robert smith" ha ha ha. then it was time for duran duran and let me tell you ... as much as people loved the cure .. they LOVE their duran duran. the crowd went crazy for them ... crazy. they were really good and played a lot of the popular / fav. songs like oridinary world, save a prayer, come undone, notorious, rio, and ended with girls on film. while they were doing girls on film i raced to the front of the pit fence/ rail and squeezed my way in so that i would have a good view for the cure. all the security there was pretty relaxed cause i think they got tired of fighing people off. we has to wait about 25 mins till the cure came on but once they did .... it was so great. they opened with 10:15 sat. night which i had a feeling they might do considering they played that on the kilborn show on thurs and it was a sat. night around 10 pm :) i won't get into the rest of their set list but they played a lot of their more popular songs like 100 years, just like heaven, pictures of you, inbetween days, lovesong in album order. during the end of bloodflowers, the security people for the pit didn't even care anymore who was going in and out so i snuck my way into the pit and stayed there for the three encores the cure did ... :) it was soooooooooo amazing. i was so close to robert and the boys :) (sigh) when they did plainsong and disintergration i almost died. robert concluded the night by saying SEE YOU NEXT YEAR ... YOU HEAR THAT HOUSE MEMBERS .... the cure (my boys) are coming back next year :). all in all the whole night was wonderful and unforgettable. however i can't say that about the audience. they were unbelievely ghetto, nasty and disrespective. some people around me had the nerve to heckle at robert and the boys and others were leaving the pit once they didn't recognize the cure's popular songs ... booo to them. the audience was so annoying and lame ... you could tell they were made up by stupid people who listen to kroq but only like linkin park, queen of the stone ages, incubus and other stupid acts. i was reminded when i went how much i despise kroq held functions cause the people that attend and the way kroq conducts themselves is beyond terrible. i do not remember having such a bad time or experience at coachella and that venue had more people and bands.

just came back from working out in palm springs. it was 108 freakin' degrees! on the way over there, passed by UCR and cringed on the inside. on the way home, passed by UCR and cringed on the inside again. i guess UCR really wasn't that bad, if you just don't think about it. wow. dr. khuen's lecture about the anterior neck sounds fascinating. where do you think i can download it? haha jk. i just heard from my sister. she's just started graduate school last week and is working in a herpes (yeah you heard right) lab. if you don't think that's bad, wait until you hear that next quarter she's working in a SARS and HIV lab. no thanks. listening to: Suba - Felicidade

finally saw 'lost in translation.' it was brilliant. scarlett gives an excellent performance as does bill murray. this is one of those subtle films where you must read between the lines. there are several scenes where both characters are for the most part silent. and you infer meaning from their nonverbal communication. dialogue is secondary. the cinematography is beautiful too. it's really rapid and fast paced... mimics tokyo. alright so this is the second good film i have seen lately. wow. finally!

"music" to blog to: dr. khuen's lecture about the anterior neck.....*snore* booo to FTC hehe. I have to dissect cadavers and YES you spend alot of time in lab....3 hours whenever we have lab!! wish i had some prosections. sorry your class sucks. my class likes to have fun..i think it's a whole school thing cuz the 2nd years are really outgoing too. ahh tradeoffs. "music" to end blog: dr. khuen's lecture on anterior neck........*thud....snore*
3 MORE DAYS :)

music to come back to blogging: mariah - "clown" ok, so ive been gone for a while. since the last time i was on here, ive moved to san francisco and have begun medical school. so far, i like sf (a.k.a. "the city", thats soooo hilarious to me). i havent had a chance to do much and check things out because 1) i got here the morning that orientation started, and 2) the saturday after i got here, my sis flew up and drive my car home. sometimes i miss my car, but then i remember how i had to drive around my neighbourhood for 30 mins every nite to find parking. for the last 3 days my car was here, i did not move it, just so i wouldnt lose my parking space. terrible. let me see, as far as school is concerned, all the people in my class are nerds, they never want to do anything other than study. im hoping after the first exam they will calm down and have fun. ive discovered an 80's club on thursday nites, which was pretty cool. theres also one on saturday nites that i want to check out, and i want to check out "popscene", the britpop club, on thursday nites as well. so much to do. anyway, back to school. we dont have to do dissections, and i think thats awesome. cos i was realising that other med students have to dissect their cadavers, which translates into MANY hours in the lab. all our cadavers are already dissected and we just look at them and study the structures. coolness, i must say. well, i suppose thats all for now. oh yeah, have fun at the show FTC!! music to finish blogging: the go-go's - "vacation"
4 MORE DAYS :)

pigern you read my mind!!! i always hate the people that cut into my lane to be one car ahead! i feel like they're invading my space. i also hate it when people honk at you when you've been signaling and slowing down to make a right turn. these f***ing people expect you not to brake and just turn right! and people who run red lights, not yellow but red lights to turn left, even though 3 cars already turned when the light was turning yellow. i can go on and on about my pet peeves on l.a. driving. the only time (well not only time i guess) that i have a real potty mouth is when i drive!

i think my life is wasted whilst in traffic. saturday morning - driving to sunset in traffic. leave l.a. and drive back in traffic. but at least i observe fellow commuters' insanity. apparently, if you are stuck in gridlock, it is a-okay to drive on the shoulder. really. it is. also, swerving in front of the one car ahead of you makes you go THAT much faster. and never let the cars merging on the freeway have it easy. make them really work for it. ah, great.

All right, I don't like Inviters much either. You know, Inviters are people who invite other people to attend the event they've just been invited to without asking the person who just invited them. People who invite themselves to events can also fall under this category. Inviters probably don't even realize they are being rude. I don't think there will be an easy way out of this situation, Skimmy Zo. I think you can politely tell your coworker that although you would like to vacation with her someday, this cruise is a college friends trip only. A reunion of sorts. Maybe that will help. Or you can tell your coworker that your friends got mad at you for inviting people because it's supposed to be college friends only. That way, you get to blame your friends! haha. Good luck. Okay, onto another subject..Tonight I bought my sister a Simpsons Duff Beer Animated Wall Clock from Spencer's, and the cashier was dressed as.....drum roll please.....a Penis. Thank you Penis, you have made my day. Listening to: Broken Social Scene - Lover's Spit

okay, i emailed new wave about this but i don't know how to handle this without being rude... but some of my college friends and i are planning to go on a cruise in november plus our boyfriends. so i called a travel agent to get their pricing. anyways, i'm talking and when i got off the phone my coworker jessica was like i want to go too! so i was like "what"? and i told her i'm going with 10 people and we're all couples. so i'm like really, in a way i'm going with 5 of my friends and their boyfriends from school. so she calls her boyfriend and says "we're going on a cruise, sunny invited me". then she calls dina (another coworker) and tells dina to go and bring a friend. and she told dina, yeah sunny invited us to go on a cruise with her and her friends. no joking...and i was just like um sure not wanting to be rude but not sounding very enthusiastic. so she's asking me all these questions about how much is it going to be, where is it going, when is it.... what the heck? i didn't invite her!!! but she's the person i hang out with at work, and i don't want to be rude...but how do i nicely tell her it's my own thing?

seriously i sometimes really hate the company i work for. ("but if you hate them so much, why don't you just quit?" i know, i know, don't bite the hand that feeds you or whatever.) anyway, here's an email that was sent out to the entire company today: "There has been some question in the past on what is expected of employees regarding their daily start times. In the past we have granted a so called "window" of up to 5 minutes after the employees designated start time for an employee to report for work without a disciplinary consequence. Unfortunately a few employees abused this window on a regular basis. Effective immediately the "window" is closed. There is no longer a "buffer" of which you can be late for work without a consequence. If your designated start time is 8:00 AM, you are expected to be at work at 8:00 AM. Any exception to this must be approved by your supervisor. Any unexcused, or excessive tardiness will result in disciplinary action. First action will be a verbal warning from your supervisor. Second action will be a written warning. Subsequent actions include the possibility of suspension or termination. We try to work closely with each and every one of our employees to develop schedules that work for both the company and the employee. If you are late, you are expected to notify your supervisor. We expect that the schedule you have worked out, or the job that you have chosen fits into your daily lifestyle. If not, maybe a change is in order.......see employee handbook page 27." Um, isn't this a little harsh???? Especially the last line. It's almost threatening. Anyway, the thing that's so messed up is that they make themselves seem like the nice guys by giving us a five minute window. However, it's CA law that you can be six minutes late and not be written up for it. We're doing research on it so we can throw it back in their faces. anyway, they forgot the addendum: "This email applies to anybody who isn't related or married to someone in the company. All four of you, you know who you are."
HAPPY 43TH BIRTHDAY PERRY BAMONTE (one of my fav. members from the cure)

wow what a weekend ... smashing all the way. i had such a good time. :) quick run down of our weekend ... sat. we got there and didn't do too much ... had dinner and took in some sights but nothing much ... we were in fremont, a city a little outside of downtown seattle. it was nice there ... really mom and pop store-ish which was rad. sunday spend all day in downtown seattle doing the tourist stuff like pike's market and checking out the waterfront and pioneer square and blah blah blah ... later that evening we went and saw radiohead. oh my gosh so good ... i'm pretty pumped about the la show now ... THEY ARE SO GOOD LIVE. ack :) man was i happy or what ... totally rocking out. the venue itself was alright ... the getting out of the parking lot was FU**ING BAD. (shiver) bad bad bad memories which i would like to erase. blech. monday we went to bumbershoot this festival they have in seattle every labor day weekend and just hung out. we went to the emp (experience music project) which was the brain child of paul allen ... one of the microsoft dudes. the emp was cool cause there is so much about music in there ... and a lot about nirvana as well. later that evening we stood in line for R.E.M. and got front row center .... you can't do better than that. oh my goodness ... R.E.M. ROCKS :) they are unbelieveable live and i'm in love with michael stipe .. he has such stage presence ... it was beyond wonderful. that had to be one of the biggest highlights of the trip. tuesday we went and checked out kurt cobain's house and the park with the famous benches. it was nice but eerie at the same time. to think that kurt cobain lived in the house and use to walk the grounds less than 10 years ago ... very haunting. and so we said our farewells to seattle ....... until we meet again :)

well, i just got back from coffee mecca (also known as seattle). it was ab fab. my three favourite parts were R.E.M. ha! but seriously. we were able to get to the front of the pit and i have (and probably never will) seen R.E.M. so closely before. plus they were in top form. radiohead was also good. it was a music filled weekend. we visited the EMP (experience music project) as well. good times.

them are really cool in their own little way. and we are way diverse which i also think is really cool b/c u see cliques within our class...and they're mostly based on ethnic lines. but we have 4 white ppl, 2 black ppl(2 out of the 2.5 black ppl in our class haha), one korean, 2 filipinos, one asian indian and one vietnamese--does that add up to 12? i think so. but isn't that great? so i love my friends and they're hella cool, sweet and awesome!! shoutouts to the 2nd and 3rd row on the (if you're looking at the lecturer) RIGHT!! woohoo. :) listening to: woman-john lennon oh oh and what i thought was REALLY weird was...ok after dinner we were getting the bill togehter which came out to 58.02...so we tipped him like 8 and some change. so one of my friends paid 7 bucks on her discover then gave him 60 in cash. so he comes back and is like...."so you put 7 on card and i'm confused this is 60 but bill is 58" and i just told him "KEEP THE CHANGE"...and he was like so "8 buck tip?" and we were like uh...yeah. and he kept asking and looking confused...and it's like ok dude....so lets say it was a 60 buck bill...10% is like 6 bucks....so we're giving you 15% tip...which is normal. so my friends are like super nice and they pitched in like 5 more bucks. the reason why i thought it was weird was that usually chinese or asian places don't really care about tip. i mean am i being ignorant or don't they usually expect like 10% tip? so either he was complaining about the tip or he didn't understand what was going on....but i seriously think he was just complaining about the tip. what do y'all think?

why are the fires so terrible. it breaks my heart. so sad. so freaky sad. why is it so dark driving home at night now ... why oh why. boooo. so i guess i should write about my trip to japan. so here it is in a nutshell, a long nutshell. got to japan at night and went to eat dinner at some random restaurant cause we had no idea where we were. it was nice but expensive. little was i to learn ... EVERYTHING IN JAPAN is expensive. the next morning got up and went to shinjuku which was a great way to see modern japan at its best. i went mad shopping there and i don't even really shop. they have these stores there called 100 yen shops which are equal to our 99 cent stores. they were pretty neat. i hit up a lot of random stores as well as tower and hmv. after that i took the subway to ginza which is the beverly hills of tokyo. there are tons and tons and tons and tons of fancy stories there like the Louis V. store, Hermes, and Gucci. really expensive stuff ... it was beautiful at night. the next day we had a small half day tour which was cool cause they took us to the tokyo tower which is only a bit taller than the effiel tower, the imperial palace where the emperor and his family live although you only seen them twice a year - Jan 2 and Dec. 23, and the senso-ji temple in asakusa which had this interesting row where you could do random shopping. later that day we went to shibuya which is this totally youth oriented place ... very young and lots of teenagers. that was pretty interesting and of course more shopping was done. the next day we went to harajuku which is a very young and trendy place. it reminded me a lot of melrose but the japanese version. ha ha. the best part of harajuku was SNOOPY TOWN. oh my gosh i love that place. how rad is that is, seriously now people. a whole store with all snoopy stuff .... so cute :) hee hee. we also went to akihabara but only for a bit. that is computer geek nerd central. everything you ever wanted for a computer or every thought about is there and more. sheesh. the next day we didn't have time to really shop cause we were leaving for hong kong. it was raining the day we left which was funny cause the day we arrived it was raining as well but it never rained when we were actually there. i found that to be a blessing. we ate a lot of sushi and noodles in japan which tasted excellent but i must admit i'm a bit tired of it now. in addition, i had some asahi japanese beer which was very light but very tasty. i tried some of my mom's sake and i must admit i am not a fan. as for the japanese people .. man where do i even start. they are all very polite and friendly but they know VERY LITTLE english so sometimes it got hard to try to get around the city :(. ha ha oh well. the men ALL wear suits ... seriously ... they look like robots or something. ha ha. and the women are very femine and made up. nice outfits with a full face of make up and hair done. that was kinda of cool. as for the youth japanese kids ... they are a totally different breed. they are so into the western like hip hop, NY, brooklyn culture. it was pretty odd to see. the guys all dressed in backward baseball caps and baggy clothes while the girls had brown hair and like orange tan skin. some weird shite but the best part was how jacked up their teeth were ... ha ha wow ... that just blew my mind. cause i mean they would look all cute but then they would smile and it was like YIKES. hee hee. moving on to hong kong ... man what can i say .... I LOVE HONG KONG. so very very much. not sure why and i know some people have expressed to me they did not enjoy HK and that's fine cause that is more hong kong for me to love :). yea we were there for two days and that mainly consisted of eating and shopping and more eating. the dim sum there puts mpk to freaking shame is all i have to say about that. the food there is soooo good. i'm sure a lot of you don't care too much about the HK so i won't go into detail but i'm slowing becoming a fob. (hanging my head in shame) i'm totally into the movies there. i got infernal affair on dvd there and i really wanted hero but it was not in the right dvd format. we are region 1 here and the uk and asia are region 3. i just love any movie tony leung is in though so go figure. okay better stop ... the fob is coming out of me. one thing i would like to note is the use of words there - bathroom = toilet, clubbing = disco and vacation = holiday. i love it. like you ask where the bathroom is they will give you a blank stare but if you say toilet they know exactly what you are talking about. and the disco part is SWEET. ha ha disco ... man that cracks me up. hey dorkus melorkus you are going to love this .... so the day we were leaving they were having like an indie band festival in HK called rockit and guess who was playing on sat. ...... ELECTRIC EEL SHOCK .... awwwwwww yea. :) i loved that.

one more thing i forgot to mention. went to the saves the day concert this past wednesday. as my friend and i were leaving, we noticed a table outside with a huge crowd around it. we thought it was another merch table until we passed by it and realized it was all the orange county kids picking up their studded belts that were being held by security. i mean, there were stacks and stacks of rolled up studded belts. ha. go figure.
