Wow, so today was my VERY first freak out breakdown in med school!! Congrats to me. As a result of my block-long procrastination I was completely overwhelmed w/ all the anatomy I have to learn in 5 days! My reason for procrastinating was b/c my professors sucked and I didn't want to study it b/c I didn't understand it or thought it was too much work. That is not, however, any kind of excuse b/c I could have learned it all on my own...which is exactly what I'm doing now. See how I sound very calm and relaxed? This was not the case 4 hours ago. At around 730 pm I had been reading a lecture for an hour...and was not retaining anything. I wanted to cry, I was frustrated and I still didn't know ANYTHING. Lesson learned: I cannot learn just by reading. I was too lazy to draw everything out. Solution: copy and paste diagrams from powerpoint onto word document and label that way. BAM! worked like a charm and now I'm thinking more like how I should, in the anatomy perspective and I am learning(hopefully). At least I feel like I'm getting good work in and thats' all that really matters. Another lesson learned: I MUST MUST pre-read and prep for anatomy lecture and lab the day before each lecture/lab. This is what they told me at the very beginning but I was sidetracked by the lack of organization/structure/GOOD TEACHING of this anatomy block. So now i know, NO MATTER WHAT, study for anatomy. And I knew this...which is why i was so frustrated with myself...but now i know it's doable b/c it only takes an hour an a half to 2 hours tops per lecture/lab. So I will do that next block. listening to: Track 12 on the Michelle Branch album...i dunno what it's called but it has French in it.

song in my depeche mode/new order mix: "halo" FOR THE CHEESE! i cant believe ur arse is going to japan. anyway, have fun. oh yeah, and ask them how they feel about WWII ;-) let me see...columbus day was a'ight. i ended up ditching my morning lectures (as usual), but i did go to my Contemporary Issues in Latino Health elective, 'cos attendance is mandatory, and i just like that class :D sadly, i did not play DDR or watch pokemon :'( yesterday i finished reading "sarah" by j.t. leroy, it was a pretty good book. i was amazed at how quickly i read it, it took like four days, i didnt think that was possible! the reason i read it was 'cos garbage's "cherry lips (go! baby go!)" is based on the character "cherry vanilla". anyway, it was a good read, and it gave me something to do besides study, and not feel guilty, 'cos at least i was reading. i really wanted to go out tonite, but 1) i slept for like 3 hours today, so i didnt think i should go (i should have studied instead) and 2) i want to go to popscene, but i dont know anyone else here who likes britpop :'( there were some peeps in my class going to a salsa dance thing, but i'm not into salsa, despite my latino-ness :-p and i cant go out next week, 'cos our final is next week. oh but then after that ITS ON! i expect to get wasted on friday nite of next week. its so funny to see the nerdiest of the nerds ("the queerest of the queer") of our class drink and dance. good times, good times. well, im off to sleep. i havent been to ANY morning lectures this week, and tomorrow i MUST go. booooo! good nite all (or day, if u read this tomorrow) be safe FTC! bring me back some sushi :) music to groove to: new order - "touched by the hand of god"

wow darth you pulled that out of nowhere. at the end of one of the back to the future's the newspaper said 2003 champions chicago cubs. but that was wrong. kinda sad, i wanted a cubs/yankees series, now it's going to be the marlins, and hopefully yankees. so this past sunday and monday was a blast. it started off in the morning when i went surfing, and an hour into some dude decides to drop into me and run the nose of his board straight into me. the feeling of your hand and wrist going numb after a direct impact is great. i thought i broke my arm again..........yes people it would have been the 3rd time if i had done it. skimmy, darth, and new wave know about it. haha. anyways also getting hit in the tooth is really fun too, but since you are in too much pain, and trying to paddle back to shore with a gimp hand, it's not worth paying attention to. anyways so i got back on shore and made a visit to the good ol ER. yes it was as excellent as it sounds. took them 2 hours to get me a room, so i was stoked. anyways turns out i just have a bruised bone, which feels super sexy, even at this moment. the next day i made a lovely visit to the dentist to check on my tooth, he took an x-ray, and said it looked ok. but then he decided that i needed to do some scaling on my teeth. what is that you may ask, it's pretty much cleaning them with the drill. it sounds so good. it feels even better. so after he made my gums bleed he decides, hey look you have a small cavity lets drill it, and since it's small we don't have to administer novacaine. yeah, it felt good when he finally drilled into it and hit the cavity. oh yeah soooooo good. i love the dentist. i don't know why i don't visit more often it's not a painful or excruciating experience at all. i think everyone in 742 evergreen terrace should take some time to go visit their local/family practitioner, it's just too fun to pass up. i hope this upcoming weekend is as fun and festive as this past one, i have a basketball tournament so hopefully i can come out unscathed. new wave and pigern, super fantastiche that you're going to tokyo. it's awesome there, i'm sure you'll enjoy it. hey and at least it's away from the good ol us of a. and you're really traveling somewhere and not on some stupid weekend excursion that we pass off as vacations. for me it feels as though the weekend excursions are more of a chore sometimes. why am i still ranting? get me off this thing. one last word, kill bill is most excellent, or is that bill and ted's is most excellent? oh no i'm right, kill bill is most excellent, please go watch it, and i'm not one to point out homosexuality in people, but if you're a guy and you don't like it, then i point at you. the homage to all the different films is awesome.

ok for the sports fans in the house...i RAREly take an interest in sports but this one caught my eye the redhead and i were trying to figure out who we wanted to win the world series...because we liked the red sox and the cubs cuz they havne't won a WS in FOREVER. in our thought process...at the time, we thought the cubs were just on a regular old losing streak....and we thougth the curse of the bambino is a cool curse and wanted to keep it going. so we decided to go for the cubbies. THEN i found out about the billy goat curse from my friend who is from chicago. dork that i am, i did some research.... so i got the info on the cubbies. the curse of billy the goat....billy the goat is/was(?) this famous pub/bar in chicago...the owner of the pub wanted to bring his goat into the game(world series 1945)...he bought a ticket for himself and the goat...and they were denied entrance. so they escorted them out of the park and he cursed the cubs and wrigley field. sooooo the strange thing i learned is...that the curse of the bambino....it TECHnically started in 1920 when the sox traded babe ruth to the yankees...but they haven't won a world series since 1918....if you do the math using 1918....the curse of the billy goat is on it's 58th year...while the curse of the bambino is in it's 85th year!! how crazy is that?! yes i'm old AND i'm a dork! :D

Funny story .... my co-worker came in sad because she said her car was stolen parked in front of her street on Friday. Her boyfriend picked her up from work on Friday and took her home on Saturday morning so she was expecting her car to be parked in front. So she called the Sheriff, filed a police report and all the stuff you do when a car is stolen. One of my other co-workers asked her to check the garage. Well, she checked down in the garage and found her car! How brilliant is that?

okay so i had a pretty busy show weekend. thursday night saw the raveonettes w/ new wave. great show, tepid response from audience. but what i really want to mention was how GAWDAWFUL one of the opening bands was, and i'm pretty sure new wave would agree although i did have to slap her hands when she was politely clapping after one of their songs (i was surprised she was clapping bc well, it's new wave, and we all know how she is w/ new music.) anyway, i think there are different levels of suck, especially when it comes to opening bands. this group, Kittens for Christian, fell into the "worst band ever in musical history, so much that it's making my ears bleed" category. really. the lead "singer" decided to mumble, whine, and wail his way through the entire set, and i didn't understand a single thing he said. i'm not exaggerrating either. from far, they sounded even worse, like they needed to be put out of their misery. or maybe it's us who needs to be put out of our misery. so yeah, if you want to punish yourself for being bad, or if you need to repent your sins, go see them. and you will be sure never to do a bad thing in your life.....(just for kicks, i got one of their CD samplers so i can play them for my friends so their ears too can bleed. it's all about evenly distributing the pain.) friday night was beulah at the troub, and i can't even describe how much i love them and how great the show was. it was a pretty long set, and they played to a packed (very enthusiastic) house. it was so so great. i don't know, if it's possible, i think i'm in love with them. saturday night, dressy bessy at spaceland. pretty good show. afterwards, a group called Electric Eel Shock from Tokyo performed. they were totally energetic and funny and so japanese!! man, can't wait until i get the chance to go to Tokyo. yeah, that's pretty much it. waiting for belle and sebastian and deathcab releases on tuesday. yahooey.

hey all. so i'm sick and getting more and more behind in med school. i think i'm going on borderline depression...blah. maybe i'm just being a baby and should just tell myself to get my ass in gear....which is what i was trying to do yesterday but BAM i got sick and i couldn't focus for shit. and i'm still sick...and will prolly be sick for the weekend. but i feel guilty b/c i should study but all i want to do is go spend time w/ the red head and my family and not have to worry about anything except that. and it's just not med school that is giving me stress...my mom's bf had a triple bypass last week and he's still in the hospital and no one is really sure what's gonna happen. so my mom is worrying me b/c she's all stressed out and that is looming in the back of my head--which is why i wanna spend time w/ my family. the redhead and i are still trying to heal from the whole break up and things of that nature and THAT's stressful b/c we only see each other on weekends...which is why i wanna spend time with him. so i try to prioritize my life but it's hard when 3 of my top priorities are not exactly in the best shape possible. yeah med school should be my top priority....but my personal life is important to...prolly much more important to me than my career. I mean i kno i'll bounce back but man i'm behind!! sorry for the random venting...but i needed to do it. i SHOULD be in class right now...but i didn't feel like going....what i really want to do is just stay in my room all day. :listening to: traffic report on star 98.7

i should be asleep but hey tomorrow is friday and i'll just sleep at work ... hee hee. okay so saw the raveonettes tonight and they were great but what is with the lackluster crowd .... geez. booooooooooooo to them. but i guess the reason for the blog (thanks to dorkus's idea) is what i saw people wearing. my gosh the 80's are so back in full force. i know i know it has been going on for awhile but yikes. what drives these people to walk into a store and pull up a shirt that they know is trendy and all in fashion and think "hey if i put this on i'll be original and different", when in reality EVERYONE HAS IT. wtf. seriously people. i like how in this one article i read ... mos def and david bowie talked about how fashion and pretty much music are basically force fed down the throat's of people. think about ... MTV, Urban Outfitters, Hot Topic, InStyle, US Weekly or People, and so on all dictate how you should dress, what to wear, what is in, what is out, what to listen to, how to conform ... dang it people conform ... DO IT NOW is what these places are screaming which is sad. well i say enough but what do i know ... i'm just one of those ugly freak girls off to the side judging, mocking and scoffing and i guess in a way if these people did stop then what would i have to blog about. spinning: nothing .... it is late and i need sleep. p.s. ....... yay FTC blogged :) ..... good luck on that test today okay ... i'm sure you will do fine and that garbage t-shirt will help you.

playing on tha laptop in the library, comin thru the headphones: garbage's cover of the ramone's "i just wanna have something to do" ok, so i didnt get a threat, per se, but i did get a request from new wave to blog. furthermore, i am at the ucsf library (ive been here everyday/-nite since friday, until they close) and i need a break. i just finished reviewing my notes for blood cells and will begin reviewing the heart shortly, and i just needed something to do (hey, like the song im listening to!). so yeah, school is cool. ive become one of those nerds that i always made fun of, you know, the ones that are in the library every day...how sad. well, i have an exam & a lab practical tomorrow. and since our curriculum is integrated, they cover EVERYTHING: histology, anatomy, physiology, biochemistry, cell biology, and all that other good stuff. its like MCAT madness all over again, the exam + practical are scheduled for a total of SIX hours! oh well, what are u gonna do? anyways, looking beyond that, some classmates and i have decided that we need to make up for lost partying time that we invested at the library. so we're drinking friday nite, and saturday nite: of course drinking, but i also want to go to polly esther's, which is supposed to play 80s (and i think 70s, hence the "polyester" reference). but we'll see what happens, as my ex-roommate would say, who, by the way, called me randomly on saturday nite as i was in the basement of some bar here in SF, he was apparently in vegas with my other ex-roommate, darth. dude, do u guys live there or something?! i hope ya'll had fun. now u might be thinking "how did he go out on saturday if he was in the library?" but, fyi, the library closed at 8 on saturday, but was that enough?? apparently not for my study-mates, for we payed a visit to the anatomy lab afterwards, and at 9:30, i had to say that was enough, and i met up with a homie i met on the EAP program in spain, he is at davis med now. then i took the nite owl bus home at 2:30 am, fun times. ok, i guess that takes up my "study break" time. btw, i will be wearing my lucky garbage t-shirt tomorrow, so that i may pass my exams (we are on Pass/No Pass - or as the 2nd years say: "Pass now/Pass later" - system) after all, remember people: P = M.D., oh yeah! oh yeah, and: FTC!!!!!! :p music to return to studying: peaches - "Fuck the Pain Away [Kid606 Going Back to Bali Remix]" p.s., i kinda wanna go see peaches here on 10/24, but i dont know anyone else who likes her, guess she's too hardcore for peeps around here :'( p.s. part II: hedwig, i think i remember punky saying that her parents deliberately named her after the sun and moon, and i also think her name has three parts: soleil moon frye, or something like that. but yeah, i always thought her name was weird. remember when she was on saved by the bell?? and speaking of saved by the bell: "no time?! theres NEVER any time! im never gonna pass geometry, im never gonna get into stansbury! i'm so excited! im so excited! im so......scared!" HAHAHA stupid jesse

has anyone ever noticed that soleil moonfry is a really weird name. and further more that it has sun and moon within it? SOLeil MOONfry....it's weird. i know her parents were prolly thinking they were creative but it's really weird hehe. ok time for beddy bye

i think i should blog, new wave gave me a semi threat, and asked why i haven't blogged in sometime, and dorkus you just reminded me. haha. so i'm in the midst of watching batman the movie. it's so good, then they just got worse and worse. except for mr. freeze cause he's haauugght! but yeah, it's kind of nostalgic watching it, cause i haven't seen it in such a long time. i forgot the quote "have you ever danced with the devil in the pale moonlight?" i don't know why, but i think it's cool. i have been in a funk lately, but now am out of it, i feel much better about things, and am ready to enjoy my life once again. i think i just let too many little things bother me, but now that i've gotten them out of the way, i hope it's clear sailing from here on out. yeah yeah, i know, right? haha. oh well, wishful thinking. which reminds me, better go check the lottery numbers. i hope, i hope, i won! haha. if that's the case, then house, drinks on me!

tears of joy ... tears of joy :) ...... AT LAST THE BOXSET! FIRST THE PUFF... THE CURE: JOIN THE DOTS: B-SIDES AND RARITIES, 1978-2001 (THE FICTION YEARS) Offers Fans First-Ever Collection of Hard-To-Find Gems Career-Spanning Four-Disc Set In Stores January 13, 2004 As The Cure nears its third decade at the forefront of pop culture, Universal, Rhino and Fiction/Elektra are celebrating the band's remarkable career with THE CURE: JOIN THE DOTS: B-SIDES AND RARITIES, 1978-2001 (THE FICTION YEARS), a spectacular four-disc treasury of hard-to-find gems, never-before-seen photos, track by track breakdowns and extensive liner notes. "The first thing I ever did when I got a new single," remembers Cure vocalist Robert Smith, "was flip it over and play the other side. I always hoped the B-side would give me another version of the artist, something as good as the A-side but somehow different. I expected great B-sides from the artists I loved... " Come 1978, when The Cure released their debut single, 'Killing An Arab,' Smith expected no less from himself than he had from his heroes. It's evident from the very first cut in this box set, '10:15 Saturday Night,' that he intended Cure B-sides to be every bit as captivating as their better-known A-sides. Among the 70 original and digitally re-mastered recordings included on JOIN THE DOTS are 'Another Journey By Train' (b-side of 'A Forest'), 'Sugar Girl' (b-side of 'Just Like Heaven'), 'Halo' (b-side of 'Friday I'm In Love'), a cover of David Bowie's 'Young Americans' and many, many more. THE CURE: JOIN THE DOTS: B-SIDES AND RARITIES, 1978-2001 (THE FICTION YEARS) will be available January 13, 2004 at all retail outlets and at www.rhino.com for a suggested retail price of $54.98. Robert Smith has Produced this first-ever collection of specialty songs, which includes a 76-page book filled with rare photos from Smith's own archives, a track-by-track breakdown from Smith and bassist Simon Gallup and original commentary written by noted U.K. scribe Johnny Black. side note i have most of these b-sides but only on bootleg and other forms. it will be great to have it all in one box set :) spinning: ocean - the cure

this weekend i went to la with pigern and was utterly disgusted. first stop was the sawtalle area where Giant Robot store one and two are. i like GR a lot but i realized half the stuff they sell there is the stuff i saw in japan. ha ha. and i found it odd a lot of white people shop there, like a lot. it was just strange cause you know they are thinking "oh look, nice novelity oriental crap to put in my million dollar home even though i have no idea what it means and i'm just buying it for the sheer fact of its oriental value." one good thing was i got to try crepe to go, this place that eric has been raving about. it was actually quite tasty but i think i ate it too fast cause i got a small tummyache. next stop was jetrag on la brea. oh my goodness that store so irks me beyond belief. grrrrr. so let me get this straight, they sell poor homeless man clothing for 50 bucks a pop. WTF PEOPLE ... SERIOUSLY W-T-F. i don't care if it is "trendy" or "vintage" or whatevers. it is an entire store devoted to being cool without actually being cool cause that would be not cool if people knew you were suppose to be cool. i could not stand being in there so i went outside where i sat on a .... A BENCH until pigern was done. it was funny cause while sitting there i heard a guy and girl talking next to me in japanese. so feeling bold and slightly bored i asked if they were from japan. they said yup. apparently they were in the states studying english at some school in sd. they come up to la to hang out and shop cause they like stores like jetrag. yea so i talked to them for all of 5 mins. that was neat. last stop for the day was melrose. i actually really like melrose cause there are some good random shops there that spark my interest. however, they have changed some of the stores there, which kinda of sucks. in conclusion ... I HATE "TRENDY" LA. on another note everyone should go see love actually and shattered glass. both very good movies but in different ways. love actually is more for girls but shattered glass is just more a thinking movie or it gets you wondering. spinning: pernice brothers - not sure what track but i can't wait to see them next month :)

hello everyone, it's november.....this year is going by fast, once again, like every year is. what do i have to show for it? not much. i still have 2 months to do something that will change the face of this world this year......haha. halloween was cool, i didn't celebrate it in the traditional sense, i actually ended up helping organize and work at my girlfriend's fair at church for their preschool and kindergarteners. it was fun and rewarding in its own way. this weekend i saw snoop dogg yesterday as well. he was playing in a basketball game right before mine in the same league. so when after his game was over, and his team was clearing the bench for my team, he walked past me and i said what's up snoop, and he said what's up homie, then we pounded fists. haha, it was pretty cool to bump into him i guess so randomly. oh well. i think it would have been better if it was heavy d.

before i get into skimmy's post i wanted to talk about LOTR: Return of the King. it was alright and if by alright i mean the best movie visually as well as storyline i have seen ever. the storyline part is all credited to tolkien and his genius, the man was incredible to come up with this entire world. i could go on and on about it but i'll just say everyone in the house should go see it ... at least twice. :) as for the wb post ... i could go on about this matter forever ... and trust me i could. i'll just say this: i have learned to really embrace my asian hertiage and to understand and respect all the hardships and work it took asians to establish their life in america. personally i think many of the negative images and views of asians and their culture come from individuals who do not take the time to get educated. movies made in the 1920's depicted asians women, like anna may wong, as temptress, slave girls or whores. asian men were often either villians, thiefs or side kicks ex. bruce lee as kato to green hornet. the key to stopping all this is for people to get MORE educated. ignorance spawns all these stupid perceptions. spinning: janet jackson - better days

wow, i haven't read the blogs for a while and it's been very interesting reading everything. i must admit, when i see a white/asian couple instead of thinking the white guy has an asian fetish i tend to think that asian girl is "white washed". especially when you see that one asian girl with a whole bunch of white people. i should stop thinking that way though, i know. well, did anyone watch the last samurai? i thought it was a great movie, it's probably similiar to "dances with wolves" new wave, but entertaining nonetheless. i cried through half the movie too. but, there's an email going around talking about how WB was asking for pretty asian girls to send a photo to get picked to wear japanese costumes to the premiere after party. it kind of relates to what we're blogging about so i'm pasting the forward here. it's long so if you don't want to read it, that's cool. =) "Hi everyone, Here is the original posting from the "Last Samurai" casting call party followed by 3 different responses. ( I think the third response is especially entertaining to read.) To receive extra credit, remember to Blind Carbon Copy me or email me completely separately your response to Cheryl Rave (This was sent out on the UCLA listserve) ************************************************************ CASTING CALL Casting beautiful Asian women for Warner Bros.' The Last Samurai Premiere After-party to be held in Westwood on Dec 1st.. Women will be dressed as village women from the film's wardrobe department and mingle 'in character' through the party, helping to create the ambience of ancient Japan, circa 1870's. There is no pay, but a chance to be part of this year's biggest Hollywood premiere with a guest list including Tom Crui! se and the rest of The Last Samurai's fantastic cast!! If interested please forward a picture and information ASAP to: Cheryl Rave Entertainment Producer Warner Bros. Special Events (818)954-3549 phone (818)954-3011 fax Cheryl.Rave@Warnerbros.com ------------------------------------------------- RESPONSE #1 FROM: Wyn Ngo DATE: Thu, 20 Nov 2003 13:30:52 -0800 (PST) TO: [Cheryl.Rave@Warnerbros.com] SUBJECT: "Last Samurai" Whore Recruiting Miss Cheryl, If you were promoting a film that depicted historical African slavery would you dare consider luring in black people who'd be "in character" as the party's "negro servants". Perhaps you might do the same with a film about Jews where the after-party would have starved Nazi camp prisoners celebrating themselves "in character". Would you dare walk that ground amongst the blacks & Jews in Hollywood? (But Asians are always fair ! game? IF YOU THINK THIS THEN YOU'RE WALKING A VERY DATED PATH SOON TO BE PAVED.) You are playing upon WHITE MEN'S racist novelty / fetish for ASIA WOMEN as docile import sex-furniture. (How convenient that you'd exclude ASIAN MEN as a COCK-BLOCKING presence amongst the white men at the party who rule Hollywood. Really hard for white fat-cats to leisurely hit on Asian "Geisha servants" when the ASIAN MALE "WARRIORS" ironically depicted in your film would stare them down during the party.) AN INSULT AT TODAY'S ASIAN-AMERICANS LIVING NEXT DOOR TO YOU: (Particularly for Japanese Americans.) The recklessness of your advertisement reflects the very dynamic of racial power differential you practice in bias for white-dominated Hollywood. (Where Asians and only the chosen "subservient" women are for the good ol' boys of the white country club to smack on the ass.) WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU? Are you this culturally st! upid despite your formal education which I imagine is culturally bias to white social power differential. Learn how to live in California amongst TODAY'S Asian Americans who will be the future employers of your white children (spawned from your white male husband) after they go to college with them. Bare in mind that TODAY'S Asian American showbiz executives and creative authorities are on the rise in Hollywood. WE WILL NOT FORGET THE PEOPLE WHO STEPPED ON US ALONG OUR WAY UP THE LADDER. So if you do not respect us out of deeper intelligence then perhaps you ought to apply your business sense. TODAY'S Asian AMERICANS are a proactive force in America with a higher education mixed with sophisticated social awareness of a dual cultural identity. This includes life experiences of RACIAL tension inherent with the American upbringing. As new incoming generations of AMERICANS WHO ARE ASIAN enter the higher status of the Am! erican society they bring with them a vigilant pride fed by their multi- cultural sensibility. So be careful that if not just for yourself your children will not not keep up with us. They may inherited from you a dated sense of racial social perspective that elevated their parents' social position "back in the day" but now serves only to alienate them in the racial future of America. PAY ATTENTION TO WHO WE REALLY ARE. As we are paying close attention to HOW YOU PORTRAY "WHO WE ARE". -Wyn Ngo (An Asian American MALE in showbiz.) ------------------------------------------------- RESPONSE #2 Dear Ms. Rave, I am writing this letter in opposition to the casting call you recently sent out on UCLA's listserv. I have seen the preview for The Last Samurai and was incredibly disturbed by the romance between Tom Cruise and the female Asian woman. Granted, I have not yet seen the movie so I do! n't know how the relationship arose and how/if it ended at the conclusion of the movie, but the very idea of a white man going into an Asian country and sleeping with an Asian women is sufficient to spark my anger. Historically in America, Asian women have been depicted as sex toys, commodified, exoticized, and hypersexualized in film, literature, and other mediums of art. Historically, white men have invaded Asian countries (such as Korea) with the facade that they are "helping" that country rise out of its third/second world status. Instead, white men have raped Asian women and robbed them of their dignity and honor. Hollywood is following suit by depicting Asians and Asian Americans as objects of commodification and hyper- or hyposexualization. Our women are too sexy and our men are not sexy enough. Our cultures are trivial and can be lumped together. One example is when Pierce Brosnan [had sex] in a Buddhis! t temple in 007. If the producers of that film had done their research properly, they would have known that any type of profanity or indecency in a Buddhist temple is completely unacceptable and downright appalling in Asian cultures. Another example is in Mulan. Apparently she was a Chinese girl, yet she was wearing a traditional Japanese kimono. This reflects the little regard that Hollywood producers have for Asian cultures. Hollywood clumps us all together and it does not matter whether we are wearing kimonos or hanboks or saris. Each Asian country is a distinct country with its own history, cultures, values, food, and honor system. However, that is not to say that when one Asian community is attacked, the other Asian communities do not rise to their defense. Having seen the preview for The Last Samurai, I fear that again Japanese women will be depicted as sex objects for white men - Tom Cruise sleeps with a Japanese wom! an. Regardless of how that relationship arose, the perpetuation of sexual imperialism by white man to Asian women is absolutely unacceptable. Your casting call requested "beautiful Asian women." Again, apparently we all look alike too, correct? During World War II and Japanese Internment, Korean and Chinese Americans had to wear pins that said "Korean, Not Japanese" so that the police officers - white people - could differentiate between who to take and who not to take to camp. In this case, you don't care. Any beautiful Asian will do. Any Asian woman can dress up in village clothing to scamper about among Hollywood's toughest white men. I wonder why your casting call did not call for handsome Asian men? Are they not also part of the scenery in an 1870s traditional Japanese village? It is my understanding that Asian women (oooh, forgive me if I make generalizations, but as long as you're doing it, why can't I?) were no! t allowed outside their homes. It was considered indecent for women to be outdoors among society. So if you really wanted to recreate a traditional Japanese village, you may want to change your casting call for ONLY men instead. I also oppose the fact that you called the 1870s "ancient Japan." In the 1870s in America, Reconstruction was in full swing. The 17th and 18th centuries In England saw the continual rise of the Industrial Revolution. Is that your definition of "ancient"? Asian countries are responsible for many renovative inventions; for example, the printing press was invented in Korea long before Guttenberg. Asian countries are NOT backwards, are NOT primitive, are NOT "ancient." (i added this after i sent it to her) The fact that you asked for "beautiful" women also raises questions. Whose defintion of "beautiful" are you using? Your western one or my Asian one? What purpose would the women serve? Were you als! o going to ask them to speak in "Ching chong cho" language to really get into character? Should they bat their eyes and appear docile, demure, servile and submissive? Would you like them to shuffle their feet? According to the character in your film, should the Asian women who respond to your casting call also sleep with Tom Cruise and the other white men who will be at the party? You sold us the "American Dream" and we took the bait. We came to America. We built your damn railroads. We did your damn laundry. We sold you cigarettes in liquor stores. We fed you Chinese noodles and sushi. We grew your damn sugar and pineapples. We cleaned your houses while you worked in a real white collar job. We slept with you because you told us America and American men were better. You did not offer any pay for this job of dressing up and mingling with Hollywood's finest. Apparently you consider it a privilege to participate in t! his party. You think we do not have anything better to do than get dressed up in costume to meet Tom Cruise. Think again. Did you not see Asians rallying against Proposition 54 in the election last month? Do you not see Asians with the highest enrollment in top-notch universities? We're your doctors. We're your lawyers. We're your judges and police officers and governors and politicians. We're your teachers and your librarians and your Hollywood filmmakers and producers. We're your classmates and neighbors and friends. We are NOT free labor. We are NOT your servants. We are NOT objects of commodification or exotification or oppression. We are NOT your sex toys. So in response to your casting call... NO, we are NOT interested in the role to play "beautiful Asian women." And get it right: Asian AMERICAN women. Sarah Park* UCLA Asian American Studies Masters Program 3230 Campbell Hall, Box 951546 Los A! ngeles, CA 90095 spark@ucla.edu ------------------------------------------------- RESPONSE #3 Dear Ms. Rave: I read the "casting call" for the premiere of "The Last Samurai." I also read Mr. Wyn Ngo's letter castigating your advertisement. I agree wholeheartedly with Mr. Ngo's criticisms of your action. However, since I do not know who you are, what type of person you are, what kind of political and cultural sensitivities you may possess, or how open you would be to feedback from Asian Americans, I don't know what I could say to you that would be persuasive and meaningful. Are you the type of person who would read the letter . . . * and immediately realize the serious mistake you made and acknowledge how insensitive it was, * or try to cut the losses and issue an "apology" even though you don't mean it and deep down think people are being too thin-skinned, * or say, "Tough shit. This is Holly! wood and I'm a Tinseltown hack. I need to make the party FUN for the guests," * or you couldn't give a shit about Asian Americans because you don't like slant-eyed slopes anyway. "So, call me racist. I'm proud to be one!" Whatever your response, I think you ought to make it clear, unequivocal, immediate and widespread. I can assure you your casting call and Mr. Ngo's letter are already circulating broadly through the world wide web, and across the country. Already, in the eyes of MOST in the Asian American communities, Cheryl Rave joins the ranks of Senator Trent Lott, Rep. Howard Coble, baseball executive Bill Singer, baseball player John Rocker, golfer Jan Stephenson, Al Campanis, Jimmy the Greek, and on and on. In deed, not good company! Most of them were dismissed or forced to resign from their jobs and/or became interminable targets of protest and embarrassment. I hope you have the courage and the wisdom to see ! the error of your ways, take it to heart and do something to correct the immediate situation and to do good for human kind in the long run. Mike Murase mmurase@comcast.net"

whoa, new wave, i have to ask, why or how you even know that song by good charlotte. i didn't know that existed. haha. and to answer your questions, remember people this only my own opinion, and if you don't like it that's cool. oh and darth, fetish is used in the context of new waves question, i agree with your opinions on what a fetish is. 1) the whole asian fetish thing is stupid. if a person likes another person, and vice versa, i don't think the race card has anything to do with it. and if they like only a certain "type" of person, fine it's their choice. i think it's stupid that people even have this idea, i mean, really, who said that asians have to date asians, whites have to date whites, etc.... also the only people that i've been around that say "ooh that guy has an asian fetish" is usually an asian person. all right, so last night was my company christmas party. i really didn't want to go but the christmas party committee (yeah, there's a committee) was hyping it and everything. last year's was pretty lame (small ballroom, low turnout, buffet style appetizers) but i sorta had fun because i got drunk w/ my coworkers. this year however, there were so many freakin' people that i didn't get to really talk to everybody. it was done casino style, which was cool because we had all kinds of tables and dealers and everything. i felt like such a retard bc i don't know how to gamble at tables so my coworkers had to teach me. (they were telling me to double down which totally reminded me of that one scene in Swingers.) it was in a nice big ballroom this time w/ a nice dinner and everything but it was SO boring. maybe i was bored because i didn't drink all that much this time. not that you need to drink to have fun at a company function. oh wait, YES YOU DO. so no more company christmas parties for me....... side note: my sister told me it was so cold in boston last week that her hair actually froze. that's right. wha???

oh yes, it's me, from the depths of medical school. i have 56 hours to learn everything there is to know about cardiology, EEK. and what am i doing? >> BLOGGING :D so i guess theres nothing new to blog about here. just school, school, and more school. oh, a funny thing, i love my school! so i'm going back to LA in a week or so, and i realised i have spent all my financial aid money. so i went and applied for an emergency loan ($650, cos i need it for "rent"), and i was all expecting to have to justify my needs for the money (needless to say, i didnt mention that it was for going out and x-mas money), instead, the lady in the office of curricular affairs asked me if it was enough?! "are u sure thats enough? should i just make it an even 1000?" OMFG! im like, uhhhhhh, i dont really need that much money. so she compromised, and i will be getting a check for $850 on monday. fun times will be had, thanks to the ucsf school of medicine. (i hope they never ever read this!) thats about all i can think of for now. just wanted to blog before i mysteriously disappeared from the face of blogger world (FOR THE CHEESE!)

in with: the buzzing of my computer please do not read if you do not want to fall asleep, i'm just writing out my thoughts, and since i have no other forum to do so, here we go. does anybody actually like their current job or workplace? what happened to our dreams and aspirations we had in our wonder years? wow, why am i rambling on about this stuff? i know it must be friday, and i must be bored in the last hour of work i have left. i guess the questions above are actually just thoughts i'm processing through my head these days. i feel that i have wasted a lot of time doing something that i probably won't enjoy doing later on, it's just for the money. bah to that, i'd rather get paid less and do something i enjoy, hopefully i am leaning towards the right direction. out with: the buzzing of my computer..................

ok...this may be a stupid question a. b/c it's old news and b. it was repealed...i was away in Philly when this all went down...but who voted for driver's licenses for illegal immigrants? i was listening to the radio and they were talking about how they repealed it and it just doesn't make any sense that it got passed in the first place. if an illegal immigrant goes to the DMV to get their license...wouldn't that be a great way to find them and then deport them? why would you be able to drive legally when you're in the country ILLegally?? i don't understandddddd. does anyone share or disagree with my sentiments? anyone wanna explain to me the specifics of this law and who the hell came up with it in the first place?? it boggle da mind.... listening to: Dr. Kiick's review of biochemistry....woohoo

Hi Everyone! It’s been a while but I enjoyed reading all the blogs that I’ve missed since November 17th. Not like New Wave has been keeping track though. =) Mac it does suck that Zo had to retire again. It sucks more that he announced it 3 days before the Clipper game I bought tickets for just to watch him. It’s okay though, the game was fun even though the Clippers lost and I wore my Zo jersey since he was there in spirit. I also came back from a cruise to Ensenada not too long ago and the swaying is normal. The first night back when you’re sleeping you feel like your bed’s swaying and you feel like you’re moving when you’re looking at the computer screen. I felt the most normal in a moving car, but it only lasts about 2 days, right? Did you go on Carnival or Caribbean? I went on Carnival last year and Caribbean this year and overall I liked Caribbean more. The ambiance and food was better on Royal. I watch Rich Girls and yes they are pretty dumb but I can’t help but watch the show. Just like I can’t help but watch Newlyweds. I was laughing Pigern when I heard them talk about why people in the Midwest wear cargo pants. Remember when Alley said her father invented them? Why do we watch these shows? I don’t know, just like Jerry Springer people have a fascination with dumb people I suppose. But did anyone else watch Celebrity Poker? I was rooting for been Affleck because I didn’t like that Willie guy. But it sucked that David Schwimmer lost with Pocket Aces. Hmmm…I don’t gamble much but talking about it makes me want to go to Vegas. Vegas anyone?

Hey party people, just got back from my day at the Tower Records in Brea to watch Tori Amos live. It was well worth me taking a vacation day, and yes dorkus and new wave i know i have about a thousand of those. Anyway I got there around 7:30 am, and was 12th in line. The tower people were really organized and cool to everyone waiting. They kept us all in line and issued numbered bracelets out so that if you were first in line you would be the first one in to see her. After getting my bracelet I slept in my car, saw Bad Santa (insert laughter here mac) then slept in my car a little more then went to lineup. I spoke with a few other fans and watched as the Star 98.7 vip winners went in to meet her got their stuff signed and then left before she sang....wtf??!??!?! yeah about 10-15 people didn't stay for the show.....that wasn't annoying or anything. We were eventually walked into the store and lined up, we were told to stand behind the vip winners who were sitting. So i was about 5 rows back, but still really really close. She did a five song set of: Silent all these years, take to the sky, Winter(my personal fav!!), Angels, and Seaside. Really cool and enthusiastic crowd of mostly died hard tori fans so that made the setting even better. Thats all for now, i'll blog other stuff later.....

it's just like if you ride the elevator up and down a lot...or if you're on the plane for a long time...or after riding the treadmill...it's normal. your body got used to compensating for the boat swaying back and forth...and so your muscles, etc are just used to that...it will take some time to adapt back. gotta get your land legs back. ;)

hi everyone i just got back from an awesome cruise down to ensenada and back up yesterday. i'll spare you guys the details, but i would like to share that good charlotte is taking over the world. on this ship all the kids, and i mean all the kids were the little minions of good charlotte. i think i must have seen over 20+ spawns of benji and/or joel. i don't think i've seen so much good charlotte paraphenelia worn at one time as i did on the ship. it was scary and disappointing all at the same time. i was so annoyed that while i was playing craps this 18 year old benji wannabe had a hot roll going that i stuck down a $25 chip on the don't pass line just so he could roll a 7. to my disgust he hit his point and pissed me off even more. haha....damn clone... oh yeah, i still feel like i'm rocking back and forth from the ship, i wonder if it threw off my interior balance or something. is that normal? med students or non meds, any ideas?

Honestly, I have yet to watch an episode of ER. I always want to watch it, but never get the chance to. Kinda like me and the ground breaking new drama....OC....ha ha yeah right. Is anyone going to watch the Simple Life? What's Wal-Mart?

i love scrubs!...and speaking of medicine on TV...has anyone been watching ER this season? it's really good. but see, i don't know if it's b/c i'm in med school or what. but i think the drama is good...so it can't be that. but it does get me all excited when they say things that i understand!! it's awesome. altho on one episode...dr. romano(the asshole) asked abby(the nurse turned med student) what the insertion of extensor pollicis longus was...and i learned that 2 months ago...and i didn't remember what it was haha. does anyone watch everwood? that's a good show too. today's a veg day...i love vegging. no anatomy for a month! whoopie!

happy belated birthday on the blogger new wave. skimmy's post is funny, a bunch of "bradley's" hahaha. the post was cool, at least it had a message and it wasn't complaining, like most of mine are. haha cheesy, perhaps, but not nacho cheesy and snickers, hehehe, jk. hurrah for the weekend has come once again. although nothing comparable to the feast and festivities of MEDIEVAL TIMES!!!!!!! is planned, i'm just glad this week is finally over. work has been a lot more hectic this past week than has been in let me say, oh the entire 11 months i've been there, but that's a good thing, makes me productive at least. now i get to enjoy some nice surfing, and r&r. as far as the superbowl goes, it's going to be a shootout....actually i don't care to watch it.

hope you had a good birthday new wave!!! and have fun at the travis concert tonight!!! that is funny that they thought you were 21 or 22. they must've been "bradleys" because they can't seem to tell what age us yellow people are. it's been a somber week at work because we had some layoffs. 3 people, but with our film side only being 20 that's 15% of our staff!!! but it sucks because one of the people that got cut was my coworker i was closest to. but you know what suprised me? when i found out there was a possiblity of layoffs, instead of being worried about my job i was wondering how much the severance was and if it was good, i think i would've been kind of happy getting laid off. but of course when i wasn't i was relieved...but what does that mean? it means a) i dislike my job or b) i'm a lazy ass that wants free money. i guess both to a certain extent..hahaha! but it did make me realize that we're in a good position right now. we're young with no major liabilities like a house payment or kids, so if we did get laid off we won't be as bad off as someone who was married with children and a mortgage. you know how we look back now and wish we were kids again because life was so worry free? well in 10-20 years from now, we'll be thinking the same way about ourselves now. so, i guess my point is that in whatever stage of life you're in, cherish it. this is a pretty cheesy post huh....

hello to the house. well, this past weekend i went to san fran. it's interesting how cities are built so differently. the architecture there is so beautiful. my friend's apartment building use to be an old victorian house and still maintains much of the character from back in the day (i.e. servant's stairs!). plus everything is much more compact than l.a., which is a common out-of-towners' complaint ("l.a. is so spread out. you have to drive everywhere."). it makes more sense to walk or take the public transportation in the city. i like the idea of walking and having everything nearby. but i would still miss driving (even though i'm sitting in traffic most of the time). but i guess there are always pros and cons.

Omigosh can't wait until Spain. Sorry guys, the house is going to hear about this Spain trip until it's over. Haha. Estoy mucho excited. Wow, that was an indication of how bad my Spanish is. today is not my day .... warning: sorry complaining will be done now .... i wanted to get the cure join the dots box set today. see i actually pre-ordered it but it was not going to come until after jan. 27 and i was like forget that. so i cancelled my pre-order and decided to get it at best buy because it was at a good price. well i drive all the way to the westwood one (on my lunch break may i add which takes way longer than i thought due to LA FRICKING TRAFFIC) because it is closer to my office and of course THEY SOLD OUT :( so then i call to see if the other best buy near pico has it and of course they have like 5 copies (sigh) but oh well i had already used all my time up. i just put my box set on hold at the tower near my house and i'll go there after work. but i so wanted to listen it today at work .... man i'm irked, pissed and annoyed. i guess on the plus side i got the new no motiv cd and it sounds okay. spinning: independence day - no motiv

i wish i watched more of american idol but i only caught the last half of tuesday's episode and yesterday i was watching the apprentice. i'm so glad sam got kicked off because he was freaking annoying. that's true that the women flirted their way into getting the gold, but the men were pretty stupid. who pays $50 for a leg waxing? and they were just really unorganized and considering they went online they didn't do much research. i thought the men should've won the first challenge with the lemonade stand. only because i thought the men worked better together as a team. but of course the women used their sex appeal to sell the lemonade too. don't you think american idol should do some kind of mental screening before they decide to broadcast some of the auditions? only because i think keith from the last season, although i was busting up laughing, seemed like he might have a couple screws loose...really. and the guy that sings "she bangs" looks like he might be mentally handicapped. it seems wrong for fox to broadcast that. well, maybe they're really not.

so much fun to be on the phone with the phone company for an hour. this is the 4th or 5th month in a row where i've done this. the best was my 3 hour phone call. whoa happy days. at least this is the last time i have to do so, unless they screw up again. okay so american idol is sweet. my favorite was the military/rap korean guy on monday. i think that is the moment that defines why i am korean. it brought the level of my pride up another notch. haha. oh yeah and just thought i'd burst some bubbles, but hong kong supastah is my friend's cousin's friend, follow that, and he really isn't a fob. haha. does anyone watch the apprentice? the guys team is getting their asses beat in, but seriously, they were the better negotiators, what the girls did was not negotiate, they were flirting. i thought that was pretty weak. oh well they still won, i guess. damn reality t.v. at least american idol is almost over for me, i never watch past the auditions. hey anybody see that one guy from hawaii in the clips that sings she bangs, he reminds me a lot of nkotb rule, hahahahahha.

tune in: pennywise - the secret hello all, hope everyone had a safe and fun holiday last week. got back from london on friday. trip was awesome. highlights of the trip: virgin airlines is awesome, the saatchi exhibit by the london eye, all the usual sight seeing, portobello market place at notting hill, watching big ben hit 12 on new years at trafalgar square and it starting to rain at exactly the same time, phantom of the opera at her majesty's theatre, seeing and saying hello to jennifer love hewitt at lax (she was on the same flight), i think she wanted me haha yeah right, seeing winston from married with children on a different tv show, and more... duds of the trip: the airports on both ends were really "fun" to get through for the holiday season, i thought the food was bland for some reason, never got used to the time difference, some of the rude people. overall it was a great week. watching the news there and coming back and watching the news here is very depressing. i just love the american press and media compared to other countries and their mediums. oh yeah, coming back to work after a vacation sucks. tune out: afi - brownie bottom sundae

HAPPY NEW YEAR'S HAVE A GREAT 2004 EVERYONE :)

I think the controversy is good, the reason behind all of it is that the film sheds a raw light of the last hours of one of the most prolific figures in history. Religous leaders, mainly Jewish, seem to denounce the film, from what I can gather. There are obvious reasons for that, but I think the general public will go see the film for what it is, a movie. What they get out of it, is left to them, whether it be an epiphany, a new view on Jesus, pure entertainment value, and so on. As a believer it has sparked my interest and I will watch the movie, but not solely for that reason. I'm not sure the intent of which Mel Gibson had for producing this film, in any case I think it is a breath of fresh air from Hollywood, seeing as how everyone in Hollywood seems to follow Scientology. This is an irrelevent point, but there was no controversy when Battlefield Earth was released, it sucked, yes, but it was based on the ideologies of Scientology. There was no religous uproar. What's my point, no point, I just had the urge to restate that I, against my own will, was forced to watch this movie, and am bitter for wasting 2 hours of my life doing so.
you mean you DON'T want to "shake your body body" dorkus? side note, anyone going to go see "The Passion"...and while I'm at it, what does everyone think about all the controversy?

tonight i went to a short film festival held by RES. it was pretty interesting... kind of reminded me of the events that the film/tv department would hold at ucla. basically, we got to watch some music videos and short films and directors/creators of them discuss and answer questions after the show. the best part was a lot of the music videos were from artists that i liked. anyway the event is held every month so check it out: urlLink RES how do you think nader will affect the democratic election? only marginally? or significantly?

went to a RES screening today. they showed some interesting video / graphic stuff. my faves were invisible skateborads by rick howard and spike jonze, madvillain - all caps by james reitano, ween - transdermal celebration by adam philips and the japanese tradition: relationships by namikibashi. the last one, the japanese tradition, was hilarlious .... so good. hey rancid girl .... i heard that sharkees place is suppose to be pretty happening but a bit on the ghetto side and anyways you know slutty girls and creepy guys will do anything to get into some tired bar. ha ha. sadly i don't watch surreal life so i can't join in that conversation. i'll just spend this rant reviewing stuff cause i'm bored - movies: dickie roberts - former child star: 4.5 it was fair ... i think the best part of the whole movie was seeing brendan fraser. i love him :) hee hee. i didn't even know he was going to make a cameo so that was a treat. starsky & hutch: 5.5 it was okay. no where near as funny as zoolander for me but it had its moments like snoop dogg and vince vaughn. shows: no motiv: 6.0 they were solid though they only played less than 10 songs. that was a bit disappointing but they weren't the headlining band so understandable.

okay house here is some big news concerning me.......after much soul searching and deliberation I am here to announce that I will not be retiring from competitive bowling this upcoming season. is it just me or are the days just flying by. i've been pretty tired everyday coming home from work ... ah work ... it will be the death of me. i just feel like i have no time for anything but it's alright cause i'm learning a lot and keeping busy. i've only been there for 2.5 months now but i'm not kidding it feels like 6 or 7. who knows maybe i'm just being a baby about this. so here is a work/weird horror story for you guys - i was in the kitchen making my hot cocoa and oatmeal when i heard three i would say yuppie mid to late 30's white people discuss the grammys. so the woman goes what is the difference between rap and hip hop and the two males gave her the most educated and well thought out answer i have ever heard. it was something like "rap is spoken poetry set to certain rhythem and hip hop is more just dancing" and the woman goes well why does rap have to be so angry and the men said cause it is coming from the streets ..... WOW ..... weird. did i mention i'm really into chinese movies now. i feel bad that i use to make fun of my one friend about it when here i am watching them all the time. :) hee hee. or at least when i can. okay serious tony leung is so handsome to me. not dreamy cute like johnny depp or hot like brendan fraser but like handsome even if he is super short and kinda of skinny. he has this quiet thinking looking which is cool. the best known movie in america i know he did is in the mood for love. so any plans for those couples out there for valentine's day aka if you are single kill yourself now day. ha ha. nothing much for me but like that should be a surprise. i know hedwig is heading to reno and that's about it. i'll post the music i'll listening to later but quickly ... prefuse 73 - plastic no motiv - where did you go air - venus low - dinosaur act missy elliott - i'm really hot radiohead kid a album spinning: uprock and invigorate - prefuse 73

hmm i guess I should blog since I haven't for a while and I may get kicked out if I don't. I just got back from Kentucky tonight. Fun times hanging with the Hutchins side of my family which I rarely get to do. Seems like get togethers only happen for weddings now, which got me and my guy cousin arguing as to who was next...fun times. In other news I have gotten a new job which i'm pretty excited about since I will actually be using my degree!!! Scary isn't it? I am leaving the housing authority to become the executive assistant to the chairman of the board of supervisors. long title i know. It should lead to bigger and better things in the future if I show quality work, so i really need to get myself going everyday. It will be kinda sad to leave my office since I have been there for 2+ years now and I feel pretty close to a couple of people there, but its for the best that I leave. New job....new car...am I actually growing up? wth? no i didn't think so either. In other news I have been so tired of late, i have trouble making it past 8:30-9:00 some days.....scary isn't it...could my months of lack of sleep finally be catching up with me? Baseball spring training starts next week...who is excited??!?!?! oh yeah just me...haha....
the shins ROCK! magic magician and all night radio can kiss my ass. that's all i got.

hm... sometimes i don't feel like a real music fan because i know that if i were to listen to janet j's new album, i wouldn't like it. something about r&b that makes me unhappy. there are a few songs of hers (or r&b in general) that i think are ok. i don't know what it is though. anyway, i decided recently that i'm not going to sell any more of my cds. well, besides the fact that you don't really get back what you actually paid... when i play an old cd it pretty much always reminds me of a certain time/incident/person. for example, i played this uk band called easyworld. they aren't great and won't do much in the grand scheme of the music world but the album reminded me of when i was in london and saw their set in camden. and some of their songs/lyrics are kind of ridiculous (i.e. you make me want to drink bleach) in a kooky way. : )

ok you guys know that Damita Jo by janet came out today right? if not WHY NOT?! HAHA so i have to rate it. let me start by saying that I read 2 reviews, one was a rolling stone one and the other was a random one off of the internet and both said she was "trying too hard" and they didn't give very good reviews. They said that it sounds confused like she's having an identity crisis. The album is pretty much trying to convey her 'real side.' The reviewers criticized that this 'real side' is really fake blah blah blah and that she's trying to encompass all of pop by having all these styles on her album. As a fan, and perhaps I may be a biased and unconditional fan even though i consider myself as a pretty fair judge...but i digress. I feel that this album is much like her other albums, in sound, layout, expression etc. The subtle difference is that she has other funky beats in there but it still stays true to herself and her style. It's not her best album, but it's good. I also like the fact that she doesn't have as many interludes in this one. Damita Jo-Janet Jackson: solid-excellent(7.9-8) Tracks to check out: Thinkin bout my Ex, Island Life, My baby...those are the three that stick out to me right now...i was studying while listening to the CD so yeah hehe. But I found myself bobbin my head to a lot of tracks...you know what that means??? lotsa dancing on the tour!!!! New Wave, Darth...you got quarters for me?

so...ok let me explain something first. as you all know i am a harry potter freak. and i say "freak" because there is a great distinction between freak and fan.(CAUTION: spoiler for the 5th book if you haven't read it yet. and if you havne't read it yet why the f*** not??!) haha fan: OH I LOVE THE BOOKS and/or MOVIES!! freak: So, did you notice in the first book where Ron saw himself winning the Quidditch Cup in the mirror of erised....don't you think it's weird that in the 5th book he gets to play Quidditch and they win the cup?! fan: Yeah I've seen all the movies. or Yeah i've read the books and I love them!!! freak: Yeah, I just finished rereading OotP(Order of the Phoenix) and now I'm rereading PoA(Prisoner of Azkaban) before the movie but I think I'll finish it way before the movie comes out!!! When is the next book coming out? ANYWAY, being a HP freak....I only know of one other HP freak....I was rereading PoA and realized OMG! Cho Chang(harry's love interest) is introduced to us in this book. In a very slight and foreshadowing kind of way, but she's in it! And I was liek OOOOH she's gonna be in the movie!!! I wonder who they cast. I rush to the internet to do some HP research and what do I find out?! they're not even gonna PUT her in this movie!!!! they're waiting til GoF(Goblet of Fire-4) to introduce her. HOWEVER, they have started casting for GoF but still no news of who it is. I can't talk to potter fans about this...cuz well, they dont' really care or remember. hehe. So I'm disheartened. OH another reason I was disheartened by Potter fans. This woman who is in my bf's class was talking about the next movie....and she pronounced Sirius Black as "Cyrus"...wtf now. And she claimed she "loves the books/movies." Granted, I used to pronounce Hermione as "her-me-own" instead of "her-my-o-knee" BUT c'mon...that's a hard one right? Ok i'll get off my ranting.... listening to: lonestar-front porch looking in

just returned to the states tonight. not sure if i should sleep or not, as it's mid morning in london. the trip overall was fab. i got to go to some local pubs and gigs. i also saw jerry springer: the opera. it's a big musical in london right now. and the guy who plays jerry really looks and speaks like him. the best part was the theatre handed out "slut junkie" and "crack whore" pins as you exited. also, i learned the french got it right. you don't need to bathe everyday. i only showered 3x during my entire trip. i admit i was a bit smelly but it's easier to not bathe in hostels. also took the train to manchester. it's a lovely city. i prefer it to london. good atmosphere, amazing music scene, high culture. london is overly congested and crowded and frankly, makes me mean. i got impatient and snippy even though i had no particular place to go. but maybe staying in hostels and barely sleeping (shared a room with a loud snoring bloke) also added to it. tip of the trip: go to the tate modern near the thames river and eat at the 7th floor restaurant. it has a spectacular view of the river, st. paul, and the city.

i too am fearing for my life now, as i have received threats as well. first off i would like to say that the 3 headed 6 legged frog(s)? was one of the most disgusting things i have ever seen in my life. because a) i freaking hate frogs and would rather be put in a pit filled with snakes rather than frogs and b) frogs are the ugliest creatures on earth. oh and clowns and porcelain dolls suck too. i'm not against dating tomboys, but they can't be butch, they need to have some feminine qualities. if i were gonna date a total tomboy, i'd rather date a metrose....wait scratch that, i'd still rather date a tomboy. oh yeah one last thing, NOFX and Alkaline Trio on tour, sweet!

Alright, so I'm beginning to get death threats from a certain person in the house, so I suppose this means I should start blogging. And I thought my blog about the 3 headed frog was gonna hold me over for a couple of weeks. I guess not. Anyway, question for ya: If you're a girl, would you consider dating a Super Metrosexual? If you're a guy, would you consider dating a total tomboy? I ask this because I hung out the last coupla days with my (totally platonic) super metrosexual super gay gay gay gay gay gay but straight friend (hehe, some of you know whom I'm talking about), and I figured I'm much more like a guy (in the mentality sense) than some guys are. Like when I get asked, "What are you thinking about?" I get all annoyed, and I'm like: "Um, nothing. I'm thinking about nothing!" And I don't want to sit around and talk about my feelings and analyze everything all the time. And if I'm dating someone, I don't want to define and analyze the relationship right away, and wonder if this person is "the one" before we've even had our second date. Get what I mean?...I'm reminded of an episode of Miss Match (yes, you read right) where the character Kate dated a metrosexual who stabbed her in the back. She said, "He gossiped like a girl, but then rationalized it like a guy." Er. That's too difficult to deal with for me. My answer: Um, no metros for me. NOT someone more fashionable than I am. And NOT someone who takes longer to get ready then I do. If I wanted to date a metrosexual, I'd just date a girl. Haha. (Listening to: Paris Combo...good French stuff.)

show: opening bands: run run run (nothing) - i don't feel like i shoud rate them considering i really didn't listen to their set. apparently they are played on kcrw and one of their songs use to be on rotation on kroq. (shrug) whatevers. though they did have this guy with a huge white man afro ... like 3x bigger than justin guruani. the pleased 4.9 - i'm not going to rush out and buy their cd but they were okay. the band was from SF so that was cool and the leader singer had on this rad rug shirt .... ha ha and droopy eyes that made him look high. main act: psychedelic furs 9 - WOW :) so good. where do i even begin. okay so richard bulter comes out on stage in this awesome gray coat and sunglasses .... classic. love his dance moves, his wonderful stage presence. they played all the songs i wanted to hear .... heaven, president gas, love my way, ghost in you and of course ended with pretty in pink and india. dang it was fun ... it was like going to an 80's club with live music which is always better. people were dancing and having a great time and that's what it is all about. however to ever good there were some bads. there was this one guy who was so wasted he was dancing in everyone's way .... booooooooo oh and here is the kicker ... he had to be at least over 40. ha ha dang. lots of over 40 somethings reliving or enjoying their 20's again. did i ever mention i was born in the wrong era. random thoughts: why is "say yes" by elliott smith so haunting good while waiting for my car my cuz and i struck up a conversation with an older hispanic couple. they asked us how old we were and my cuz who is almost 30 said 34 and i said 25 .... ha ha they did not believe it. they thought my cuz was like 22 or 23 and they thought i was 19 ... sweet :O why is no one blogging ... grrrr. ha ha. what happened in madrid, spain breaks my heart and i find it kinda of errie. march 11 ... 2.5 years after sept. 11. i want to dye my hair but i can't but i want to ... i could do black spinning: son of sam - elliott smith

I saw The Passion on Sunday and it was a very good movie. Even though I read about Jesus dying for my sins or heard sermons about it, this movie really had me visualize the amount of torture and suffering Christ went through for us. The scene where he is being whipped was the toughest part of the movie to watch. Although the movie is a bit graphic and violent, I still think it’s a movie worth watching. I can’t usually watch violent movies, but the amount of blood and gore doesn’t overpower the movie and the message as a whole. As far as this movie being anti-semitic I can empathize with why Jewish people feel this way. I think I was watching Dateline, but they were saying that historically, it was the Romans that ordered for the death of Jesus, and that King Heroid (?-is that his name) isn’t as compassionate as they portray him. That he also wanted Jesus to die, not only because he felt pressure from the Jews. But I just don’t think that this movie will cause people to have a feeling of hatred toward Jews. Especially if you go to church, the Bible predicted that they will deny Christ, and it always writes about how the Jews are still the chosen people. I guess that’s not really a point…but even if people don’t go to church or are not religious, I don’t think people would feel hatred towards the Jews, considering that throughout the movie Jesus is asking God for their forgiveness and trying to teach people to love their enemies. But at the same time, people that are Jewish are seeing it from a different perspective, and I can understand why they feel that way. On a lighter note I’m going to the Britney Spears concert tonight and I am a little excited. I know, a lot of you guys despise her, but it’s not like I think she’s a great singer…but I went to her last concert and it was a lot of fun. I admit that I like a lot of her songs and the girl can dance! But I can’t believe how much I paid for it, and if I had to purchase the tickets again…I might think twice. What was I thinking when I thought it was a decent deal? Let’s just say I saw a roundtrip plane ticket from LA to Chicago for the same price as I bought my Britney Spears ticket.
I kid you not, I just saw a three headed, six legged frog on CNN. It was real, too. Gross!!!
WTF?!?! that's crazy.

so i too saw The Passion of the Christ and i agree whole-heartedly with your comments Mac. I cried twice and almost cried once it was so powerful. An hour into the movie I just felt like stopping it all because it was so painful to watch and I didn't want Jesus to suffer anymore, despite the fact that I knew it was going to get much worse. as far as the "controversy" goes, i can see why the jewish community would have some worries about the film possibly sending the wrong message. especially at the beginning of the movie, some might have thought, "why are the Jews so pissed at Jesus? why can't they just leave him alone?". To impressionable, narrow/close-minded, dense people this alone might have made them miss the whole point of the movie. So in that sense I can understand the concern. the movie is set out of context and if you don't know the history, then you might have felt lost or have taken the wrong message away from it. i'm curious to see/hear what non-Christians who don't know the story of the Passion think about it; if they felt lost or confused or mad. i think a couple of my friends who aren't Christian are seeing it next week so we'll see. At any rate, I think it was an excellent movie and it was told very well. And that's my 2 cents....

These are just my opinions/beliefs/views, everyone is entitled to their own: This past saturday I watched The Passion of the Christ . It was the most intense movie I have ever seen. It is very graphic, but done in a manner where it is justified. To see Jesus put through that kind of torture was an eye opener. I already had knowledge of what had happened going into the movie. I know Jesus died and shed his blood for our sins, but to actually see an interpretation of the events was humbling. It has impacted me spiritually and personally. This is my account of the film, and others may or may not share the same sentiments. It is very powerful, well done, and influential, if you let it be. Regardless of religous beliefs or non-belief, I think everyone should make the trek to watch it. Has anyone else seen the movie? I would like to know what other people think of the film or what they took from it. This topic is different from our regular banter of how bad Good Charlotte and Dashboard Confessional are. If not, then it is understandable, everyone is entitled to their own beliefs and keeping their opinions. If you have no qualms, then please share. I'm interested.

Hey all, I finished work today. It's kind of bitter sweet. I thought I would be overjoyed by it, but I still have not gotten the full effect of it. I'm going to miss my coworkers and San Diego, on the other hand i'll be closer to my family and friends. Tonight is the last night down here, i'm just getting together my odds and ends stuff. As I was cleaning out my fridge, I realized that I wasted a lot of food. I feel guilty for doing so, hopefully I will make more of a conscious effort to not waste food anymore. I have the month of May off to do whatever I please. Hopefully I will be in Hawaii. Then I start school in June. I wonder what it is going to feel like to be a student once again. I think this time around I will be more focused, as I know what I really want to be doing. Hope all of you have a good weekend. Oh on another note. My friend's girlfriend told me that she is going to wax his face. I told her that sucked and that I did not think it was appropriate because he is not thrilled with the idea, but she kept insisting that she wanted him to do it. Anyways, I guess she is doing this concurrently as I blog. I feel bad for him, but then again it is his own fault too for not standing his ground. Am I the only one here that thinks this situation is messed up?

Best Worst line from Bring It On Again (yeah yeah): "Why suck when we can NOT suck?" First Runner-Up: "Oh yeah, well you wax your butt!" (Note to self: Why oh why do I do this to myself??) Moving on...I recently purchased the Jem and the Holograms: First and Second Complete Seasons DVD Set...omg it is SO "truly outrageous"!!!!! I love it. You are automatically transported back in time when you watch this cartoon. After watching a couple episodes, I have figured out that there are various "rules" the cartoon follows. For instance: 1. Rich people appear out of nowhere. Example: Jem and the Holograms are performing at a Battle of the Bands, and out of nowhere, a rich producer offers the winner of the battle of the bands a movie contract, $$$$, and a mansion to live in. Second example: Jem and her crew are at the mansion and out of nowhere a rich French countess appears and invites them to her yacht party. (The same goes for villains. As soon as one exits, another appears out of thin air.) 2. Bad animation. I'm pretty much convinced they hired several different artists to draw the cartoon, and then they piece it together. Example: In one scene, Jem's pink eye shadow disappears, then appears again, then disappears. Second example: Rio (Jerrico/Jem's bf) eyes change from blue to purple. Third example: There's two different theme songs; you can never guess which one they're gonna play. 3. Lack of security for any of the villains. Example: A bad guy gets onto the set of Jem's movie and knocks over a gargoyle off the top of the building. Second example: The Misfits find their way onto the yacht and ruin the party. Well, they ruin everything actually. (If however, there happens to be a security guard, the Misfits use their conniving way to get in, and they ALWAYS do.) Funny side note: One security guard says to the Misfits: "Who do you think you are? Duran Duran?" 4. When you are angry, knock over furniture. Every single time the Misfits get angry which is pretty much all the time, they knock over furniture to show how angry they are. 5. All Jem songs sound the same. All Misfits songs sound the same. 6. Rio must always save Jem from sort of physical danger, causing Jerrica (who is Jem) to get jealous. Um yeah, Jerrica is jealous of herself. She crazy! 7. Nothing should ever make sense. Example: Why would Jerrica's dad leave her a hologram machine (Synergy), a closet full of rockstar outfits, a cool car, but not enough money to take care of herself? I don't know. Don't try to think about it either. Things not making sense if probably the best thing about the show. You are sitting there most of the time going, "Huh??" Okay, I can go on and on about the show. Bottom line: I love this dvd set. It's truly addicting. Oh yeah, The Misfits rock, Jem and the Holograms suck!
